title: Excellent for what I need
text:
I have a five bedroom and three floors home.
The main source is on the top floor. I hook up the main router on the top. I have the small two that connects on the second floor one at each end of the floor. So far it is great as long as no one messes with it at the source. I love the app because I can share the password via text. Test the speed and look at the security and it has parent control and guest which I don’t use but options are there. I love the fact I can be anywhere and I can use and look at the app to see if internet is connected I do not have to be in my home. It is very easy and simple to set up.
I had Orbi since April 2020. It was my first router. It was price range $200. It is well the investment. I was looking more for width. This is  what I needed. My brother would get cheaper brands it always gets knocked off and he buys more and it is all over the place. It was very frustrating not being able to get connected.  I hope this help. Thank you for taking the time to read my review. Best luck to you in finding what is right for you. I would recommend this . 100%

title: Great product, but the app, ugh
text:
Router & satellite are amazing compared to Google wifi Mesh. Yes I like Orbi RBK50 design, it does fit into our space nicely. Counting all the Ethernet ports Netgear gave us (7) not including port for modem which makes eight. It really does makes a difference hardwiring smart TV’s, Apple TV and other devices through Ethernet ports like PlayStation. I have notice zero refreshing while streaming cable television or watching Apple TV. All cable providers stations look visually good and thinking about it my 5.1 surround sound sound fantastic. I have 22 devices connected including security cameras etc. I haven’t experienced one single hiccup. 

App:
It’s basic but very functional for what’s immediately important. I do question quality of Speedtest just because sometimes it gives ridicules low results compared to browser Speedtests which put Orbi off the map and beyond the stars fast. Maybe update for app will fix issue. I don’t mind having a second app called Circle to manage family members because it keeps apps much cleaner and less junky. What I don’t like is paying monthly subscription and since I don’t use Circle anyways it really doesn’t matter but I do get occasional notifications which is annoying from apps. Security: Running Bitcoin Core drives security features nuts and yet too redundant. I think to open ports and assign static addresses Orbi needs access through a browser. I haven’t needed to do this.

title: Total mess of an app
text: I had a nightmare with the setup. It didn’t recognize the satellite when it was 10 feet away. This app provides nothing but endless waiting. Search for the satellite? How about watching a spinning circle for 3 minutes? Now do that 20 times and you will start to get the idea. For some operations there is a progress bar, but for most it is just a spinner and a message to wait for several minutes. After a reset the router forgot all admin passwords (including the default!) and was inaccessible. Finally after some combination of resets and new setups and power cycles, it finally found the satellite. Ultimately I started the install around 5pm, and everything was up and running by 9pm. The router has been working well for 8 days, but the app is broken. The device list is populated, but the app says none of them are connected to the network. The network map shows both routers, but no connected devices for either of them. The web interface for the router works as expected and shows all connected devices properly. So it is clearly an issue with the app parsing the data provided by the router. Finally, the app forces you into creating an account, and demands personal information. It automatically signs you up for trials of some virus protection BS, filling my inbox with spam from a company that I never interacted with. Welcome to a world with ads ON your router. This app is pathetically poor, and 2 stars is a very generous rating.

title: Intuitive Network and Device Security Management
text: I love the control and insights that are provided by the Orbi app. I can see my Network map and actually understand it. I get pings when one of us unwittingly opens a website that may be malicious. It is nice to get advanced warnings from invisible cyber threats. It is hard to know otherwise. I can perform updates without going to a website and so far all updates have been minimally intrusive. My only complaint is the Armor, Netgear, Bitdefender rabbit hole you wind up in once you pay for a device. There is no way to define/understand these individual, free standing products when they get bundled into a subscription. And good luck getting support when you get a message that your device isn’t protected when you thought it was. This can be troublesome. It gets worse when it is about to expires. Then you get emails telling you to renew...I shut off auto-renewal in all my accounts so I can be a good consumer at the end of a contract. I won’t spend money to renew if a product drops in productivity. However, in the case of Orbi, I have little concerns. If there was a way in my account that I can see Orbi, Armor, Bitdefender all in one place, I would give this 5 stars.

title: Parental controls are cumbersome and lacking
text: I was wondering pretty excited about getting this WiFi router.  I’ve been hearing such great things about mesh type WiFi routers.  Setup was easy and comes in two flavors; the Orbi app or a web browser.  I chose the Orbi app and it was easy.  Our WiFi was up and running within 20 minutes.  Every item we have connected easily to the router and speeds seemed great (no specific speed tests were run, just watched Netflix on each device).  I have a 14 year old and needed to setup some limits.  I had time limits for each day on my old router where it would allow a connection to the internet between 7am and 10pm on his devices.  I also have a few websites blocked through my old router.  I could not do this on the Orbi.  You had to use Open DNS (separate website) along with the Orbi’s parental controls menu to setup websites or servers.  You could not, however, setup times for internet access to devices.  This is unacceptable to me.  The Orbi has Circle Disney setup on it, which gives you more parental controls at a cost of $5/month?!?!  That is also a separate login. Both Circle and what little parental controls within the Orbi router was just too complicated and lacking for me to keep the device, so we returned it and reconnected our old WiFi router.  We now will be looking for another router manufacturer for our home.

title: Impressed on all accounts
text:
I am blown away by the Orbi system. I switched from a normal tri-band router to this 2 satellite orbi (three piece unit) because I was unable to stream two roku sticks at one time. I have a three story home with one orbi unit on each floor. Not only are my streaming devices spit fire fast, but I’ve got noticeably faster upload and download speeds to my Xbox one console, my computer, work laptop, the families laptops, our tablets and cell phones. 

The app is easy to use and understand allowing me to password protect the router, check on the net time and traffic, and even check my speeds and diagnose connectivity with the tap of a block. If my net is down because of the fiber optic work the phone company is doing, my 4g/lte still allows me to connect to the unit! 

All in all it’s a very... VERY... powerful unit for what I believe is an affordable price. I feel like I spend less time working on the families computers and more time enjoying them and our streaming services. If you’re a multi level home or a multi player household, or even if you just have lots of friends, family, or company in your home, orbi is a must have in my book.

title: Great Home Mesh WiFi System
text: I bought the Netgear Orbi Ultra-Performance router 11 months ago. Initially when I bought it I expected to have good internet coverage throughout my home. So far, the orbi has exceeded my expectations in that regard. Not only do I have good coverage in my home, but also just about everywhere else on the property. The interior walls of my home are constructed of 4 inch concrete blocks and the exterior walls are constructed of 8 inch concrete blocks with rebar. All devices on the wireless network experience the same network speed everywhere on the property. There doesn’t appear to be any dead spots. This is especially useful for my wireless Reolink home security cameras which I have located on different corners of my home. I can also see all of the devices connected to my network through netgear’s mobile app and I can allow or deny access to any of these devices. Disney’s circle app which can be used with this device is a good free app for enabling different levels of restrictions for devices on the network.  Every now and again I would have to restart the router because of a problem with my internet signal at home. Aside from this minor inconvenience this is a great product and I’m happy with my purchase.

title: Super fast
text: Well my last router I had was a eero I really liked it when I had 300 mbps plan. Than I moved to 1 gig speed but the eero could not handle the speed. Than I read about WiFi 6 and it could handle 100 devices and handle 10 or 12 devices at once without losing speed.. I had to have it. I set up Orbi very simple and set up right away. At first speed was at 500 mbps but as it settled in my iPad wirelessly running 400 mbps and my step son wired his computer into Orbi and he’s running 960 mbps.. love it finally have a router that can handle 1 gig speed.... come on 5G I am ready now!! It’s very expensive but honestly if you can afford it it’s worth it.. I was just wasting money on 1 gig speed because I just find the right router.  I have it now.. we usually have 20 devices and more on our router and eero did a good job managing what devices were used but kids with Xbox pull so much from your internet also 10+ devices the eero could not hold speed.. Orbi WiFi eats up all devices and  spits it out....handles it all... very happy.

title: Should be better at optimizing Device connections
text: I have 2 Satellites to have a triangulation of coverage in my two story house, which should provide excellent overall coverage. But the problem is, when a device is connected to the WiFi, which ever Hub or Satellite was closest on first connecting... that’s where it forever stays. Simply put, no matter where I go in the house, say with my phone, if I’m closer and better connected to a different satellite, the system doesn’t automatically switch my connection to the best connection. It keeps me at the first, which may be bad at the other side of the house. This is retarded and defeats the purpose of adding more satellites... other than to just extend that initial link, which is fine for a static device, but seriously, mobile devices need to be able to get the best connections always. I should also be able to manage at least manually how a device is connected with whichever base or Satellite I want. Give me the control if the system itself fails to optimize the connections automatically. This to me is a huge oversight and failure of the company and product. This needs to get fixed, if they want to be seen as a premier WiFi connection company.

title: Not easy to set up
text: I have been trying for over 3 hours to get this device setup. It won’t connect to my existing WiFi. And there is only a little card as a quick start. No operating manual at all. I can’t go back to any previous screens on the app. There was no ‘security’ verification in the app. Orbi shows up on my settings as unsecured device. Right now it’s not worth the $200 I paid for it. I can’t get ahold of any tech support that is advertised. Troubleshooting through their website...gave all info only to be instructed to contact internet service provider. I was on the phone with internet provider for almost an hour and I got so frustrated with them saying that my modem will be turned off when I connect orbi. Well...I got to get the dang orbi connected first. 🤬. ETA…a year later and this thing has given me nothing by headaches. Every couple of weeks I have to reset everything and start over. Now I’m being told that if I want phone support, I have to pay another $140. Because they only allow 90 days of support. I’ve used more than 90 days in this last year resetting this thing. They sure do want your money for a product that is crappy. And then more money to actually help you make it work. During my last reset, all of the info from it got wiped out of the app. ??? How???

title: Works well
text:
I give it a perfect rating for setup and initial configuration. I bought a Netgear Orbi AC3000 router with an additional satellite.  I plugged them in, followed the prompts on the app and I was up and going with excellent WiFi in no time!  Once you’re in there’s not much to the app other than monitoring the speed and connection.

My one critique is their insistence on downloading a separate app called “circle” to utilize most of its unique features.  If you want to pause internet, set up parental controls, and manage specific devices, you must download Circle.  First of all why cant all of this integrate with the Orbi app?  And second, upon downloading Circle (and setting up yet another account), you must pay a monthly subscription if you want to use it.  (Yes there’s a free account option but it’s extremely limited - not worth it).  Call me old fashioned I assumed all this would be included with a very expensive router but I guess not.  It’s not the end of the world, but the circle thing felt like a bait and switch.

Over all, I give it a good rating because it works well, but not perfect because I don’t want to pay a monthly subscription.

title: Solved all of our WiFi dropouts!
text: Have the xfinity xfi gateway 1gb plan and their WiFi service is not very good on its own, coverage for a big home was terrible and in an act of despair, having had multiple calls to xfinity customer service, it was recommended that I purchase the xfi xpods mesh system to help upgrade the WiFi experience; long story short, the WiFi in our home got worse, continued intermittent connectivity dropouts, family members upset bc their games didn’t work or dropped, etc. I had to reboot the XB6/gateway everyday but that really didn’t help much. Beyond frustrating! Enter the Orbi Mesh RBK753. Before plugging in the Orbi to my network, I had to first disable WiFi at the Xfinity gateway completely then put it into bridge mode. From there, I followed the directions for the Orbi router setup and placement of the two satellites with the guidance of the Orbi iOS app. I was able to get everything up and running within 10-15 minutes. No more WiFi dropouts and four times the speed throughout the house. The iOS Orbi app is stable but I wish it had parental controls included otherwise I would give this five stars.

title: Blazing fast, but setup was a nightmare
text:
Just moved into a 100-year old multi-story house with plaster walls that were eating my old wifi signal alive, so I switched to Orbi after seeing the great reviews. Now that it’s finally set up it seems solid, and the reviews weren’t kidding: the 500Mbps wireless throughput still blows my mind.

But Netgear has got to figure out why it’s iOS setup process is so terrible. I have as simple a setup as one could: pulled the router and satellite out of the box, plugged them in, but it took half a dozen tries for them even to recognize each other. And worst of all, every time the devices refused to cooperate, the app just sat there with no help, no advice. Netgear is clearly a hardware company, not a software company. I hope they’ll do some serious, advanced testing of their app—especially the new user onboarding process—so others won’t find themselves stuck in a seemingly endless loop of failure and rebooting as I was for nearly an hour.

Finally, their decision not to devote the meager resources to enabling landscape mode in the iPad version of their setup app is a slap in the face to users. I use my iPad as a mini-laptop, with a keyboard case, and their app is one of the only apps I’ve seen that stubbornly refuses to rotate the UI to accommodate my setup.

title: Ga girl living in Al!
text: After 6 months on I will say I am impressed! I purchased this because of the WFH order but with everyone home I was struggling to actually work! I have not had one Teams, WebEx, Skype or Go To meeting lag time meeting since instillation and I couldn’t be more thrilled. Watching a moving using my Firestick and Dish has never been better! I decided not to take a star away for the lack of instal directions but to simply include them in hopes others can have a less frustrating install. -Unpack it completely and place your Orbi’s where you will use them and leave them there don’t plug into electricity. -Download the software -Go to your ISP and disable their WIFI signal. -Begin with the included directions to this point. KEY! If you have to start over.. use a pin to reset the Orbi holding it in for 5-10 seconds until the lights change. If you do not turn off your WiFi signal Peace be with you! You will go in circles! And don’t name it the same! Worst advice!

title: Fast and Powerful
text: I was having all sorts of problems in working from home with 4 adults spread from the second floor to the basement. The issue was that with other systems there was coverage of the whole house, the speeds really dropped when you got away from the router.  Also when I added a range extender, there was coverage but still very slow speeds.  My fire sticks also reported weak signals.  All solved with Orbi.  The key is the very fast back haul between the two routers and the better range on each router at the fastest speeds.  Even if you don’t have any or many devices that use WiFi 6 , the Orbis do use it on the back haul to connect the satellite to the main.  I also upgraded my cable internet to 300 megabit and I get that speed in all but one room now. The one room that doesn’t has a 50 megabit speed.  I’m going to get a second satellite and see if that solves the problem and also gives me coverage in the backyard during the summer months.

title: Works great some of the time
text:
After researching pretty extensively I decided to upgrade to Orbi. Also, I have the Zodiac iAqualink pool automation system with the iQ20 wifi receiver which I installed about three years ago. Problem is upgrading from Apple Airport Extreme to Orbi actually made things worse instead of better. Now my iAqualink system goes offline constantly. After having a pool automation expert look at it he recommended that I purchase the Orbi outdoor satellite. I did that and now have a strong signal at the pool equipment but still the iQ20 will not connect. After talking to Zodiac tech support they said that iAqualink will not work because the Orbi band steers between 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz and that the Orbi needs to be set to static 2.4Ghz. There is no easy way to change to static 2.4. I ended up setting up two separate SSID’s: one for each band. Now the iQ20 will connect about 10 percent of the time.

On the positive side, in the house I have great signal in all rooms and streaming shows and movies work fine.

The reason the app gets 3 stars is because only the most used settings can be changed there. Have to go to a web browser for advanced settings.

title: Big old house, great coverage
text: 8500 sq ft of steel frame, plaster lathe walls, brick, 5 floor brownstone. Router in basement next to phone, cable, Ethernet distribution system. Have had many routers - latest was tri-band nighthawk. Bought that with 5 access points. Problem was either use 1 ssid, but then your might not be logged into strongest signal. Or, have different ssid’s for each access point so you always knew which ap you were connected to, but of course that meant you had to change to closest ap to get best signal. Fine for me, but drove wife and kids crazy. Bought Orbi ac3000 router and 2 satellites at Costco for 299. Have since purchased another satellite. Router in basement, switch in media room so all lan, satellites on floors 2-3-4. Now strong signal throughout the entire house. Everyone happy as they log in once and have great connection wherever they are. Especially great now that 2 kids are working from home and using Zoom, etc., all day long for classes and work.

title: Once it's setup, it's great!!
text: I've had the Orbi WiFi station with two satellite units for about ten months now. The setup presented me with a bit of a rough start but it could be contributed to my not understanding the instructions fully. Once I was done setting it up, everything worked great!! I love the app as it allows you to monitor your Wi-Fi network and it shows all devices connected to your network.  The app also allows you to turn off individual connected devices. You can also see each device and which satellite it's connecting to or if that device is connected to the base station. You can also reboot the Orbi router from the app. I really like this setup and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for complete whole house coverage of their WiFi modem signal. I live in a 3100 square foot house. There is a pretty good distance between my Wi-Fi base station and other rooms in the house. I had weak signals in several areas of the house but this Orbi fixed that problem once and for all.

title: Great Harware, HORRIBLE software
text:
Orbi routers are fast and easy to set up (initially).  I installed the two-unit system (WiFi6) so that my family of four could all work at home and be on school/work Zoom calls at the same time.  The hardware accomplishes that well.  But NetGear’s Orbi software and apps, which are they require you to use to set these units up and then keep them running on an ongoing basis, are HORRIBLE!  I am a 30 year-experienced technology executive, so I have seen MANY different admin software systems over the years.  The NetGear software and apps are among the worst I’ve ever seen.  God help you if you ever need to reset your password.  Their system simply times out.  Or the “default” password, which their own screens provide to you, simply is wrong.

I have decades of experience administering networks and systems, so, while it is certainly possible, it is unlikely, that I have forgotten how to type.  But no matter how accurate a typist you may be, if you are planning to set these systems up in a home environment, and you are NOT a tech profession, I would skip NetGear Orbi completely and instead get the Velop or Eero systems.  You and your family will both be happier.  Their software actually WORKS!

title: Unbelievable
text:
I was having major problems with my wifi. We have a 3 floor townhouse that has cement in the walls between units and AC/heating ducts throughout the house. Needless to say the wifi in our place was terrible in the basement.   Because we now work from home we built an office on the top floor.  Router is on this floor because of necessity but now the 2 lower floors have very spotty wifi.  I didn’t want to make a big investment so I bought a smaller extender.  It didn’t work well so I returned it and bought another one. That didn’t work well either. I finally caved and spent a little more than I wanted to and I am so glad I did.  The Orbi system is SPECTACULAR!   It was easy to set up and I have 2 satellite components on the main floor and in the basement.   I went from 34 mbps to 227 mbps.  
This was one of the best investments I made during the pandemic and the subsequent work from home situation.

title: Can’t hurt their business…I’m only 1 customer
text:
The app is just ok as it applies to the UI.  The main issue is that the status that displays in the app, is sometimes inaccurate, and is usually different than what displays on the web portal.
Overall, I am VERY dissatisfied with both the hardware and the software, because I’ve only had this kit for 18 months and the satellite RBS50, is inoperable after 1.5 years of use.  Netgear support admitted that the satellite is now useless and refused to address it, because I didn’t purchase the extra coverage and I am past 1 year.  They did not want to discuss it with me, and longer, so they lied and said they would escalate it and email me within 48 hours.  The only thing this accomplished was getting me off the phone.  It is true that the customer service rep was cordial, but I really don’t appreciate being lied to, not to mention wasting money on something that should last more than a year and a half. Now, the WiFi signal on the router (RBR50) goes out about once a day.  I guess Netgear expects consumers to replace technology about once every 2 years or so…Keeps them in business, I guess.  But hey, I can’t hurt their business, I’m only 1 customer.

title: Horrible App
text: This app is a disgrace for Netgear.  It allegedly lets you set up an Orbi system, but let me back up slightly.  When you open the Orbi box there is no instructions on setting up, just “download the Orbi app”.  Ok, I do that and go through the process ... and the wi-fi is VERY buggy.  After much wasted time I figure out how to login via the internet as an admin.  Of course this information IS NOT included in the app.  On the admin site I discover how to set the ORBI as an Access Point.  Very, very, very important step in porter to use with my cable router (for internet, TV, phone).  Ok, get this going.  Still have problems but I get the system sort of working.  Then I discover on the Netgear site that there is a User Manual for the ORBI.  Why isn’t this linked in the “Getting Started” piece of crap they include with the hardware or on the Orbi app?  This is just disgraceful!  As a part of my searching for information I discover there are updates to the firmware on the Netgear site, but for some reason the app and the admin site do not see these, huh?  After finally getting the system essentially stable my wife accidentally unplugs the power cord.  Now the system is totally unstable and the app is ZERO use.  If I can, I will return the Orbi ....

title: Needs ability to manage NetGear Armor from any device
text:
Overall, the app works pretty decent. It lacks several settings compared to logging in the web portal but I suppose that's to be expected in this consumer level router. 
The biggest issue I see is the inability to manage NetGear Armor from any device I'm signed in to. Only the very first device that was used to set up the router can access or see the Armor settings and get notifications. No other device, even if it's properly logged in and can manage all other aspects of the router (devices, network maps, wifi settings, etc) can manage the Armor settings. It stubbornly refuses to allow access to the Netgear Armor settings with an "Error: Unknown Error". I talked to Support about it and they were unable to meaningfully assist. 
Range and signal strength of the router itself is great. The incidence of wireless network related interruptions has significantly decreased since installing it.
 I just wish the Armor portion of the app could be fixed since it's a significant part of the security on the device.

title: Doesn’t Work And They Don’t Care
text: This app is nothing but a screaming frustration. We have so many issues with it, and with the supposed ‘Support’ we paid for (another waste) and the admins of this app could care less. We’ve opened case complaints with them, which are NEVER followed through on. Their front line ‘support’ either doesn’t have the authority or the training to solve issues and when our case was kicked to to ‘App Team’ for resolution, it might as well have been kicked into a black hole. No one from NETGEAR has EVER responded in any fashion to our issues, and when we call ‘premium’ support they are nothing short of obstructionist, refusing to acknowledge a case has moved beyond their capacity to resolve. Our case complaints for multiple problems with this app was opened on August 29th. As of Sept 3rd, No One from NETGEAR has contacted us as promised, (originally supposed to be 24 hours. Then 48. Then - silence from them) Don’t waste your money or your time with this app - the admins/creators certainly don’t want to waste any of theirs with those of us who have purchased this system and downloaded this app - and encounter problems.

title: Maybe the router, maybe the app
text: I have an Orbi system with 2 satellites. When it works, it’s fantastic. However, when it doesn’t it’s a complete nightmare. I went months without being able to login to the app, despite having the appropriate passwords. In a final effort, I tried to recover password only to have it ask me security questions I never answered. I know I didn’t answer them because the first one was “what is the name of your oldest sister”. I don’t have any sisters, so I KNOW I didn’t answer that question. NETGEAR will not help you if you are out of warranty unless you want to pay a ludicrous price for “support”. I already paid over $400 for this router, stuff your support. Finally after having the unit unplugged for DAYS during an outage I was able to reset from new and have access to the app. Last night I rebooted because speeds were slow. Now it only recognizes one of the satellites and every time I open the app it goes offline. I will never buy another NETGEAR product again, hand to God. And I’m probably going to have to replace this even though I’ve barely had it 2 years, and did I mention $400? Buyer beware.

title: Talk About Lightning Speed
text:
My previous WiFi setup included a router and range extender.  Well that setup kept causing me grief, after awhile, my family kept telling that they couldn’t get on the internet and which I was always forced to restart my modem and router.  Also, I am an IT consultant by profession and I would get the peanut gallery remarks that I could fix other systems but not ours.  I was done with that!
So, my next solution was a mesh network and which I researched for choices of hardware.  The Orbi by Netgear was the clear choice.  I checked network speeds at different points in my house with my prior network setup and after the install or the Orbi router and satellites.  I was amazed to say the least!  Although my upload speeds remained near the same, my download speeds were four to five times faster.  I am impressed!!  I’ve only had it in for a day, but I don’t expect any degradation as more of my family’s devices join the network.

title: Works Much Better than Velop
text:
Easy to set up. App is not only simple for basic user - there are advanced tabs to get into advanced settings and adjustments for power user. 
Getting great speeds from main base (238) AS WELL AS from the satellite unit 218. I had signal issue in large house due to distance and walls blocking - this Orbi has Excellent speeds from base AND satellite in other end of house. I’ve tested signal all over the house with iPhone App and this Orbi System is working great. 
I have Velop in another house and it never worked well - signal degraded to almost zero when away from parent node - it couldn’t get signifigant signal because of  a wall and it had trouble getting thru Glass Window!! But the Orbi is delivering Great signal - Netgear has some of the beat reviewed WiFi systems and the speciality in this area is apparent in this Orbi Mesh. Excellent all around. (I have been testing for 3 days - if anything falls apart I will update)

title: Great Product/App
text:
Great product and app functionality.  I’ve compared to nearly all of the major competitors to Netgear, within the last several years. I’ve tested the tri-band Mesh style WiFi networks as well as the prior generation of dual-band WiFi networks.  I have not compared the Orbi system to any of the latest generation, WiFi 6 networks.  

The Orbi systems seem to have a higher throughput than their competitors, as well as superior stability of the hardware (from an overall perspective - as in it works great UNTIL it doesn’t work great). Any instabilities in hardware firmware are usually easily resolved with a factory reset of the Orbi system.  The set-up process of the network using the Orbi app is painless and convenient.  

I do wish that all the configuration settings that are available via the Web UI admin access were available via the App admin access.

title: Easy to set up and FAST speeds!
text: Great price on Netgear Orbi Mesh system (RBR10 with 3 satellites (RBS10’s)for $200!!! Setup was very straightforward—downloaded the app and followed the step-by-step directions on the app. Took about 10min.  All satellites up and running.  Used the same network name and password so all devices immediately online without having to find network again.  Ran speed test and have increased 10-fold!!!!...from pitiful single digit download speeds with my old Time Capsule to now over 100Mbps!  May not have quite all the bells-and whistles of Google Nest, but has got me running all devices super fast, and I rather prefer not having intrusive google embedded in my house. Not sure how much better the new tri-band systems could be, but can’t compare to this price with 3 satellites blanketing my whole house and back patio with blazing fast service!! Couldn’t be happier!!

title: Love Orbi ...but Sonos may need app notes to make work
text:
I love my Orbi mesh networks. I have set up Orbi’s in 2 locations both w 3 Satellites. Yes me also has an outdoor satellite. They are easy to set up and thru pilot is great. 
I also have several Sonos ones in both locations. The first Sonos set up took minutes and went smoothly. The second setup was not a fun experience.  To make Sonos work I ended up shutting down all satellites and other devices in the Orbi network. I had to factory reset my Sonos one’s and Sonos move (most likely  because  I tried to many time to connect each one). Once I did all that I was able to get all the Sonos speakers to connect.  This may be partly a Sonos issue but the Orbi forums lead me down paths that were way off and included telnet SSID editing. Luckily I called an IT friend who gave me the idea to shut everything else down and start from scratch.

title: Customer support
text: Recently purchased RBR/S 50 and added an outdoor satellite. While the system is new and requiring a few firmware updates, it seems to be functioning as advertised, which is to say excellent. I had to spend a great deal of time on the phone with customer support, which is a major negative, but for once in my life I can say the customer support was absolutely outstanding. Yes, it was with an IT guy in India, but he patiently worked with me (I’m NOT a computer guy) for over two hours and walked me through the step by step process to update the firmware to get the system functioning properly. My hat is off to their support team over there, it was 5:30am and his shift was ending yet he slugged it out with me and got everything up and running. Huge thanks and much appreciation. Now, if someone can figure out a way to get better internet bandwidth in Mexico, I’m all ears.

title: Great router but issues with smart home networks (Nest, etc)
text: First,I am not a router technician but I do know if they’re working or not and this router is very reliable (except smart home devices-see below). The set up is quite easy and coverage pretty good but I have a ranch style house and still needed one additional satellite for full coverage. I have over 25 devices on the network and it handles them well. Also, whenever there’s a power outage Orbi signs back on with no problem without any assistance from me when the power is restored. Again, I’m not a technician but it works for me. Also, one last note, if you use devices for a smart home like cameras, lights or thermostat Orby is not compatible with many of them and you should know that upfront. Read the list of devices that Orbi will not recognize. I found that my nest cameras work on the Orbi network even though it says it’s not compatible but the connection is not as stable as it is with other devices.

title: Reliable and stable way to network
text: After having been an ORBI user for over 5 years and having changed providers, the unit and its satélites make a reliable and fast way to connect to the internet. We use the network to do a variety of activities on line and they have worked flawlessly due to the consistency of the unit and satélites. The reach is sufficient to cover the entire perimeter of my home and large outdoor areas. Positioning the satélites at different levels of the home is the key to coverage. The main unit is hardwired to the router and placed in the center of the house and the other units are at the further ends of the house. Try different locations if your system is weak in some areas. Update your firmware often and you will enjoy a fast and reliable internet throughout your home.

title: SUPPORT: UPDATE THIS APP PLEASE
text:
I love the Orbi system. But the app does a real disservice to the Orbi system experience. 

 I just lost more than an hour of my time trying to find out why my daughter’s iPhone won’t connect or show up in the list of connected devices after being paused.   The app’s features are very basic.  I got rid of a Luma system, which had a far better app...that’s the only thing I miss about Luma.  I was expecting a much better app with this system.   I just recently upgraded to the RBK40 cable modem/router combo.  This is an awesome system, but your app needs a lot of work.   I deleted the app, reinstalled it, reset my daughter’s iPhone, forgot the network, re/entered the password, and it’s still not showing up.  Now her phone is locked out of our home WiFi including the guest network.  What gives?  For the love of everything sacred, Netgear... revamp the app and give the Orbi system and your customers the app we deserve.

title: New Orbi experience
text:
Wow...I have a single floor condo, not large , 1400 sqf, but the layout was too difficult for a standalone router (WiFi/ router combo) from Xfinity to handle with reliability ( very weak signal in remote bedroom). So I purchased a new modem and a Eero mesh . I followed all setup as per instructions ( 3 unit mesh) and soon began to see erratic dropouts. Work fine for a while , then unexplained red lights indicating it is offline. I would have to reboot modem, restart the Eero units, and restart my printer. After 5 days, I had enough, returned it, and bought the Netgear ORBI Trivandrum WiFi  (2 unit mesh) . Setup was excellent, easily followed, but upload and download speed in remote rooms excellent! 
Very happy with this unit so far. 
And my wife likes the white colored units... that was almost as important as the performance! Thankyou... excellent product

title: New update 9/16 review
text:
Thank you for updating the look of the app. In the new profile view could you please allow a minimized view and allow me to reorder the list? That would be very helpful and faster for me too. 
Also, a feature that would help is to set a device or few as high demand. My wife is a teacher and here laptop fails to connect often. Either the WiFi or her vpn is the issue (not a techie so idk). It would be nice when she needs the bandwidth to give her greater connection over the other items. I am going to try to setup profiles to pause some smart devices to give her an attempt of better connection. This is not ideal but what other options do I have, really what other options do I have? I have her hard wired in the main room of the house (with all our kiddos) when it’s really an issue - she does NOT like that.

title: Works great, but finicky
text:
I really like this system... ONCE I got it set up. I had it running fine for two days, then decided I wanted to rename the Orbi base and then instant I did that, it got into a reboot loop (would immediately reboot as soon as it came back up.) Factory reset it and configured everything again and it’s fine now...  but I’m leery of it doing this again when I want to change a setting or rename it. 

That said, my biggest gripe is the LAME selection of icons where you name your devices (and choose an icon to represent the kind of device it is) so you can see them easier in your list of connected devices to pause them, etc. There are no icons for “smart home” devices like light bulbs, plugs, etc... not even a generic “IOT device”! This pathetic list of icons is inexcusable when it would take like 10min for the app dude at Netgear to add 50 more.

title: Customer Service is the worst
text: Orbi is a great product yet if you have a problem that needs resolution there are no Pro’s to help. I have spent hours on hold only to get to first level tech who wasted my time turning it on and off and then putting me back in the queue for another interminable hold that was not picked up at all. I paid extra for Technical Pro support for a year to stop this and was not given a different number to call . The only different number is for business and that number the Pro’s won’t help you and they send one back to the queue which is the first level tech that only knows how to take down your information and shut the orbi down and up again , no troubleshooting to ascertain the problem. Paying extra for dedicated support is only a waste of money. It’s so sad because they a great product above the rest, but without support it’s not worth it.

title: Not what is advertised
text:
Compared to all of the other routers I’ve had over the last 30 years this one probably has to be the worst where it comes to configuration.

75% of the settings that you would expect to be able to change you cannot, either through the app or through the web interface.

Some settings you cannot even access through the web interface and have to be performed through the app.

The netgear armor system is a nightmare, whatever you do do not under any circumstances turn it on, otherwise you lose access to a lot of sites including Apple Updates and a lot of first-tier sites which the system just arbitrarily blocks for no reason, on top of that, if it will give you the option to open a ticket to have it checked then you have to submit a ticket to bitdefender and wait 72 hours for them to add the site to the allowed list.

I cannot be the only person in the world and looking at the netgear forums I am definitely not the only person in the world that has asked for the iOS updates to be unblocked, yet every time an Apple device in my house needs updates I have to put in a ticket to have it unblocked.

I’ve tried turning off the bitdefender armor system and it makes no difference.

Also if you do use it it will tank your Internet speeds.

I have a gigabit connection and I’m lucky to get above 200mb even at 5 o’clock in the morning when nobody else in the world is connected.

title: Made a switch
text: I’ve been a long time user of the wireless router from AMPLIFI. It worked great while I had a dismal speed to my home from AT&T. Recently I received a fiber connection from another company at 1 Gbps download speeds. I spent a considerable amount of time trying to figure out why my AMPLIFI router was only putting out 15% of the speed I was paying for from my ISP. Even though it was advertised to handle such speeds. The LAN ports certainly were putting through 95% of this speed. Needless to say I was forced to buy another router. I purchased the Orbi Ax6000 Tri-Band Mesh 3 pack. Even though it was a bit pricey, I’m very happy with its performance thus far! It was easy to set up and pumps 950 Mbps wirelessly. The app is easy to use and I wish I had purchased it sooner.

title: Can’t Separate 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Bands
text:
I’ve been an avid Netgear supporter for years even advocating for other to buy their devices, but I spent nearly $300 only to find out that you can’t create separate SSIDs for the bands or even just have the ability to manually change which bands certain devices connect to at all. I’ll probably be returning the device and not buying anymore Netgear devices again.

Edit: Update to Developers response - I think it’s great that the developers have decided that to take an approach that is not customizable while incredibly expensive leading the consumer to believe its a high end product. Having a default setting is one thing, that lack of ability to provide consumers a choice within advanced settings is poor design. Like I stated, I will no longer be purchasing Netgear products as this is the generic type of response that is received when anyone brings up this topic in the forums on Netgear which they have repeatedly being doing for over two years with no response from Netgear to resolve the issue.

title: Orbi is unreliable
text: I have had the Orbi RBR750 router for over a week and in this time I have had numerous problems that persist even after replacing the unit I initially received. The Orbi randomly stops broadcasting the network name and drops the internet connection for all connected devices several times daily. It sometimes also reboots itself for no reason at all and WiFi signal is lost while it is doing so. I have tried to work with netgear tech support, which has been difficult because there is no dedicated phone number for the RBR750 and I am bounced from agent to agent each time I call till I can get to the qualified expert. The new unit I installed yesterday failed after just 15 hours and technician has asked me to change one of the default settings, which he said is a bad setting. I don’t understand why the unit ships with bad default settings. If this does not fix the problem I will have no choice but to return this very expensive router and opt for a competing product.

title: Something is wrong!!!
text: I am sooooo frustrated with this app. First off I would like to say I have technical aptitude. I have tech background. This app will log me out after a few months, then when prompted to enter the admin password(s) (that I’ve changed 3 times now) it doesn’t recognize the password!!!! No I’m not an idiot who didn’t write down my password. I have had to do this 3 times since I purchased this system over a year ago. This has caused me to do a factory rest 3 times!!!!! I then have to reprogram my alarm system cameras and enter new passwords on all connected devices. If you call customer support, they want to charge you almost 200$ just to get help. I am so tired of Netgear. I would return this product if I could. The mesh system works fine otherwise. The app has some serious glitch problems. Here’s the kicker… the app works if I use it in remote connect mode!!!!! If I connect to my WiFi… it prompts me to log in. Totally ridiculous. I’m finished with Netgear.

title: Netgear listens to feedback
text:
I’m updating my previous review from 1 to 4 stars. The latest app revision does away with the requirement to have a Netgear account. It has reverted to router credentials only. Thanks for listening. 

1st the Orbi is both amazing and infuriating. When it works it’s the best home router hands down, but it tends to be unreliable and plagued by half baked firmware updates. Now they just updated the app.  The first thing it asks for is a Netgear account. Not the router login. So now I can’t manage my Orbi without having a Netgear account. It’s so frustrating. I just want to go into the app and turn off my kids iPads. Why can’t I do that without a Netgear account?  I could one version ago. Everything piles up. Eventually the Orbi is going on eBay.

This is a follow up to Netgear’s canned response as to why it’s good to require the Netgear ID for app access.

You’ve got to be kidding me. Your own post from the community page advises against using remote access to protect against the VPNFilter Malware.  This right here is emblematic if the whole Netgear experience. Oh and BTW on the Genie app you’re off on the device type so when I set a device type on the Orbi, it is miss identified in the Genie app. Again an example of what to expect from the Netgear experience, just slightly off.

title: Used to be a great product
text: Orbi successfully used to cover my house in fast WiFi.  There has always been a degree of dropped satellites etc, but nothing major.  With the last update, the app is pretty much useless.  If I’m at home and connected to my Orbi, the app can’t find the network or wants me to login as admin (not allowing me to input my actual user name, the default stays on admin and my password does nothing.  If I turn the WiFi of my phone off, and connect to Orbi remotely, it works fine and I can see all of my devices . Problem is, I have very poor cell coverage at home, which is why I want my WiFi to be great. With what just be an entire company full of technology minded people, why have they allowed their product to be buggy for so long after an update.  Customer service is tough to contact and even harder to get them to follow up.  Hate to say it, but I’d go with a different mesh network if I hadn’t already sunk hundreds of dollars into this one.

title: Cannot remove an inactive device
text:
An inactive orbi that was already returned to the store still shows up in remote management, as a disconnected device. When selecting the device, I was told it was offline. Apparently, there is no way to remove it from my account. Called netgear tech support, the lady could not be more unhelpful. She could not understand the issue. When finally understood it, she saw the inactive device in my account. But due to safety concerns, she said she had to escalate it before deleting it from my account. Come on, I was asking to remove access not gain access to an orbi system? What is the safety concern?

Can you please just update the app to give customer an option to remove an orbi they no longer wish to remotely manage and no longer have physical access to?

title: Good upgrade from the nighthawk app.
text:
I used to use the night Hawk app before I purchased this Orbi system .. It was a nightmare. I would label all the list of devices onlyFor the app to change all the labels to whatever  it decided or thinks it was, and not what names I gave them. No matter what I did the names or labels would always change, so you can’t identify what IP address each device had and what they were. Really annoying and frustrating. Having over 35 devices, I wanted to know what they were, their IP address and connection speed.
This Orbi app solves that issue, but now it’s way too limited in the types of devices on the list. There should be items like, Garage door opener, iMac, Roku, Apple tv, Mac book, wireless hub ceiling fan, alarm panel and more.
I hope that Netgear adds to the list these items soon and some I haven’t thought of.

title: WiFi can no longer be scheduled on/off
text: I’m upgrading from a NightHawk R7000 to the Orbi RK50. The app seems to have a bunch of issues - it takes a long time to find the satellite, then once found and clicked on to get the details the WiFi shuts down. That happened every single time until I deleted the app, power cycled my iPhone, re-installed the app. Now it seems to work (what kind of weird bug is that caused by?). Coming from the R7000 I was used to being able to power off the WiFi at night - I don’t need my house full of electromagnetic radiation when the family sleeps. After spending over 2x for the Orbi I just discovered that feature is not available there. That’s not acceptable to me - so either Netgear delivers an updated firmware with this feature, or this system goes back and gets replaced with one from eero.

title: Orbi hardware is great... App not so much...
text:
I followed the Quick Start guide and used the iOS app to set up my Orbi RBK50.  Everything seemed to work fine.. Firmware updated. Devices connected but no internet access.  I spent an hour with Comcast and they said the problem is with the modem that I own.  I called Arris and they said they would help me troubleshoot the modem but I first had to pay them $40.  No thanks.  I spent another hour or so searching forums and considered going through an exercise of MAC spoofing but concluded I didn’t have an extra 3 hours to do that as I’ve already spent 3 hours at this point.  I then started a chat routine with Netgear support.  She first suggested I get on the phone with Comcast.  Nope!  She then asked me to re-set up the Orbi using my Web Browser instead of the iOS app.  Everything worked great!  Even the app eventually worked!

The moral of the story.  Ignore the Quick Start guide and use the Web browser to set up your Orbi.

title: I have used many MFG apps. This is the best.
text: I have used most of the Netgear apps (better than others) with their various routers and have found them to be fairly decent in general. This Orbi app with the mesh system I have found particularly impressive it actually has tools I will use within the app rather than just being an app that sits on my devices “just in case “. The only negative I can find is the Speedtest does not correlate with online speed test that I typically use. It gives me the same speed next to the router as it does using satellites 400 feet away. In reality my online signal has denigrated 50 to 60% at 400 feet. BTW; 400 feet away from the main router is an unheard of distance for WiFi. The mesh systems are game changers.

title: Extremely Delighted!
text: Very reliable, and effective satellite. I used to have wired connection and rigged cabling for the 2nd floor by routing from the modem on the 1st floor to the attic level and used an ethernet switch to distribute to each room. If only this system was available at that time, it’d have saved me the hassle. When I learned of this product with it’s tri-mesh and satellite - I just wished it’d simplify it. And it did! Satellite sits on the attic wirelessly from the main router on the 1st floor, which distributes wired signal to each room. I tested the internet speed and it is always reliable as if It was wired beside the main router. So far, I am so glad to have purchased it. I am also able to monitor connected devices and usage traffic plus the Circle app for content monitoring is a plus.

title: So far……
text:
We’ve had our Orbi for over a year now. I can confidently say that it has a been a huge asset to us, more so now than ever with CV-19 still out there, virtual schooling, and teleworking now adding strain. We’ve rarely ever had any issues that I couldn’t handle or take care of in a matter of minutes. 
I can’t say much, if anything at all, about their customer services because I haven’t had to even get to that point. I hope that our system’s performance continues as we are huge fans of how awesome it works. The new question now is do I try to upgrade to Netgear’s newest wifi version (portable/plug-in capable) or just ride this one til the wheels fall off? Either way, it works great!

title: Intermittently requires whole system reboot because of dropped connections
text:
I find that my Orbi system intermittently has connectivity issues. About every 3-6 months it will spontaneously disconnect from my wireless devices and also from the satellites. 
I have to unplug and reboot the entire system to get the router and the satellites to reconnect. And the the Orbi app says everything is fine and there are no firmware updates. 

It is extremely disruptive to me because I also have a saltwater aquarium Wi-Fi monitoring system that the Orbi system disconnects from and requires manual reconnection.  If I am on vacation and the Orbi system disconnects then it is dangerous for my saltwater aquarium and equipment.

I manually reboot the entire Orbi system and there are no firmware updates so what is the solution here? It seems to me that I just need to buy another system from a different company.

Overall I am unhappy with the performance of the Orbi mesh Wi-Fi system and it’s connectivity issues.  It is also very expensive at nearly $1000 and all I see is more adds and emails asking me to spend more money on security and parental control programs that should be offered with a $1000 mesh Wi-Fi system.  I also expect better performance and network reliability from a brand new $1000 mesh Wi-Fi 6 system.  I would not recommend this product to other people to buy.

title: App is a total waste
text: Somewhere along the line this app has changed. App was working fine until a couple of weeks ago! As shown in the description I used to be able to look at devices and see how they are connected ( wired, wireless, 2.4G or 5G ) just by hitting on devices in the app! Now it shows all devices connected or not! I then have to click on device to see how it is connected, additional step! Also when doing Speedtest I get extremely lower results than when I do Speedtest thru a separate app! Unable to change server that app connects to for Speedtest. Contacted support and was told to reload previous firmware and that would correct issues! What’s the sense in doing that, I want to be able to use latest firmware! Also was told it was issue with my Orbi RBR50 router and Orbi App! Pay a lot for these routers should be no issues with router or App!

title: Okay solution
text:
I don’t know if this is due to being a new model (RBR750) or what, but the Orbi solution/app lacks many very basic features. Can’t schedule wifi availability, no parental controls on my particular model, no notification that a new device has joined the network, can’t set up profiles and assign devices (sort of a parental control feature. Seems a $400+ solution would have these feature. My older, cheaper devices did.  I mean really, I can’t control the sites my kids are able to access, not even for a fee??? Wow. 

I do like the speed, future proofing (Wi-Fi 6), and stability has been good too. All a plus, but without parental controls and the ability to verify who/what is joining my network, I’m not sure I will keep this product.

title: Awesome, at first. It got worse with updates.
text:
All I can say is I’ve bought 3 sets (router+2 satellites) and the first one for my father seems to run fine. Then I bought a set for me. I even recommended it to friends and coworkers. All my range issues were resolved. 

Then after a while the Armor software glitches and couldn’t be reset. I had a lousy tech support experience, gave up and returned it for a replacement at the store with the awesome return policy. The replacement has been working great, until now- the app won’t allow me to login. It simply says “Something went wrong.  Try again.”  How helpful. Trying again just makes it happen again and again. 

After going through more steps with tech support than a broadway musical, the problem remains. 

Oh and guess what, when you can’t sign into your account, setup and tech support are pure hell to get. They use your signin as the gatekeeper to everything. It’s like losing your passport ID while in a foreign country. Total nightmare when it doesn’t work.  

I’ve updated my support ticket and told them I’d they can’t fix this- it’s going back again, but this time I’ll choose a competitor. Sad way to lose a customer. When it all worked- I was happy. However if you don’t have reliability- you have nothing. Whether it’s the app or the device itself doesn’t really matter.

title: Finally, the whole house, connected
text: My home’s construction includes multiple brick walls between my modem and the most distant rooms upstairs at the far side of the house. For years I have tried countless products from countless manufacturers in a vain attempt to get strong, clean and fast WiFi signals. The Orbi was connected and set up in minutes. The signal was strong in the most remote room, with just two satellite units, despite passing through three double thick brick walls and other sheet rock walls. And, upstairs to boot. The speed is decidedly improved. The mobile app is nice. The information available when connecting to the modem data pages is extensive and welcome. The price is reasonable also. Now I need to find a place to recycle all of the old junk.

title: Disconnects devices at random
text:
This is Orbi's v2 devices. V1 was an equally horrible experience but I read that Orbi fixed it's issues in v2 and I saw lots of good reviews. I have no clue how they aren't seeing what I'm seeing in both these Orbi systems versions.

Sometimes Orbi does disconnect a device, but more frequently you see the end device still connected to the Orbi but not able to reach the internet (yet other devices located at the same distance or even further can). NetGear's Orbi really rudimentary support staff always claims that it is not their issue despite it affecting a wide number brands. You don't have any recourse other than rebooting, waiting and hoping that this expensive system chooses to let your computer, your home security device, your IoT devices back through to the internet. 

Don't buy! Avoid like the time-draining unreliable network that Orbi is. At best you are playing Russian roulette, but the symptoms may not show up before you can return the system.

title: Impressed
text:
I have the 2 unit Orbi, one router and one “satellite” that was purchased at Costco.  Each unit has 4 internal antennas.  I suppose it’s really acting like a simple router/booster set up.  However, and this is a big however, the boost I have downstairs is significant.  

I just switched to a provider that promised 500 up and 500 down. On my hardwired PC I am getting what was promised.  According to speed test I’m getting 250 down and 195 up in my living room downstairs on my mobile devises, about 10 feet from the satellite unit.  That’s pretty good.

One interesting side note, when I run the Orbi app speed test it says I’m getting 500 up and down on my mobile devise.  It does not agree with the “Speed Test” results.  Either way, I’m very happy with its performance.

title: Poor reporting of connected devices
text:
I am probably anal, but I assign IP addresses to the known devices in our family. As part of that setup I can also pick a symbol for the type of device (laptop, iPhone, IoT, etc) and give the device a name.  I typically do this via the web interface.  But then if I go look at the iPhone app at the connected devices the names are all confused. Some are correct, others are swapped around, and others have some other unintelligible name that came from the device itself. I can edit the names and symbols from the phone app, and when I do they appear to be correct. But then if I back out of the Device Manager and go back into it, they are all messed up again. 
It’s nothing end of the world, but it is really poor software. And I have experienced similar behavior in the web interface going back before Orbis

title: Orbi Is Spot On!
text: I’ll keep this review short and sweet. If you are looking for the raw speed that you pay for each month, and you are tired of the old reboot and wish your WiFi comes back up, you need Orbi. This WiFi system is hands down the best that I ever owned. It’s very reliable and true. I’ve had my system now for over six months and I haven’t had to reboot it once. My high speed internet is truly high speed. I’m paying for 200 Mbps but consistently reading 215 on the download! The features are getting better, but as one other person mentioned the parental controls could be better. Over all I give it a 5 Star because it delivers on the speed and reliability that I look for in a high end WiFi system!

title: My Orbi Experience
text:
Great product, easy set up! No real manual but it is not needed. The automatic install leads you through the install process. Only one problem/question. Why was a password installed? I don’t mean factory installed pw. Also security questions had answers, I did not enter this info. I could not complete the install until I stick a paper clip in the reset hole and followed reset instructions. Then I entered my pw and answers to two security questions. This leads me to believe my unit was a demo or a returned unit.
Bottom line, this is by far the best router on the market. I am hoping my ISP will match capability of this router.
I am a long time owner of Netgear products, I look forward to future purchases.

title: Very buggy setup after crash
text: Spent almost 6 hours dealing with reset up of app and devices after iPhone XS kept on dropping conference calls... Zoom, WebEx, Teams etc. Installed system about 2 weeks ago and tried firmware update to no avail. Waited almost 3 hours for customer service and then told not supported because I bought 3 months ago - past 90 days... only got around to replacing Google WiFi about 2 weeks ago, because the speed was only modest when not close to satellite. Orbi has dramatically improved speed to over 400 Vs 25-50 on Google Wifi but frustration factor not worth it and super lousy tech support... don’t even bother. Going back to Costco

title: Hellcat Speed for WiFi
text: The Orbi WiFi 6 Smart Home system is like having a “Hellcat” engine in all my wireless devices. I had yet to experience the power of 500mpbs internet service until I purchase this system. My UHD streaming service would always give me fits when watching a live sports, movies or gaming. When having quest over and multiples of devices were accessing my WiFi at times it was embarrassing. Now I can have parties outside and everyone can use the WiFi with Hellcat speed. The satellite units are appealing and fit right in to my homes decor and no ugly antennas sticking out. Very pleased with this purchase and highly recommend the Orbi Smart Home WiFi 6 system.

title: Deliberately useless
text:
Don’t bother with this app. Use the web setup. Unless you have a completely generic setup the app blocks you from competing the setup because it can’t autodetect, and won’t let you enter manually. There is no way to break it out of its loop other then cancelling the app. There is no visible option to set up the access point in bridge mode. 

Spectrum and other isps are deploying converged service routers that also already use the same ip address as the Orbi, so the easiest way to upgrade from the crappy built in wifi would be to slap an Orbi in and put an address on it. Because of the known ip address conflict I was going to preconfigure this access point for the person who’s home this will end up in. Couldn’t do either because this thing is fighting me at every step.

just put an advanced setup button on the front screen of the app, or even a link to the web ui.

title: Orbi Changed the Game for Speed!
text:
After 13 years of having to put Ethernet Ofer Power adapters in our home constantly fighting dead spots I purchased an Orbi Mesh Network.  

We have a 5k square foot house in Chicago.  Long and narrow. My wife and I both work at home and our offices are literally on polar opposite side and floors (hers third floor front room mine basement back room.  

For 13 years we’ve struggled to get WiFi coverage in the house. Regardless of where the ISP Router was placed we just never got consistent coverage.  

Well after purchasing the Orbi and putting one base unit in her office and a satellite in mine Holy Shnikies! 359Mbps download.  

As a professional Voice Actor working full time in a home Studio I upload major audio files all day, connect to Studios all over the world, and as such have a wired connection in the Studio with the Orbi.  Believe it or not the Orbi network is faster.  

Unbelievably easy to install, it pretty much installs itself.  Just do what it says.  

And with a 13 year old child in the house the new parental controls are awesome.  

Best WiFi Experience Ever.

title: The abrupt loos of connection
text:
I’ve used several routers over the years, Cisco, linksys, netgear. Being in a two-story house with a basement I new I needed a high caliber router and mesh network seemed like a no-brainer. 

The installation was a breeze and it included the base and a satellite. I’ve connected few wired devices and the remaining 18+ where all wireless.

Very quickly I’ve experienced fluctuations in  speeds. Over the time few firmware updates seemed to stabilize speed issues. However, one thing that has been happening is the abrupt internet connection drops.

The device shows strong WiFi signal yet it struggles to load google page, eventually timing out with no internet connection message. What’s interesting is that the connection comes back right after it and everything loads just fine.

To isolate my internet provider issues, I was able to confirm overall internet connectivity trough cable modem during Orbi connection drop.

This issue has been now hunting me for over a year. I’m very disappointed and surprised that such premium retail product is in the market and not being addressed by netgear. Btw, the connection issue is one of the most user reported problem and can be found on Reddit and google search.

Also the range in my 3800 sqft house is spotty with base and satellite apart by 60 feet; drywall interior walls and wooden floors :(

title: DO NOT USE THE APP!
text:
It started off really well. It set up the router fine, displayed all connected devices, showed speed test, etc. 

However, the first sign of trouble was that the speed test history kept being deleted. I thought that was a minor thing. It annoyed me but it didn’t make me hate the app. 

The big problem with the app is that it doesn’t allow your device to see the network. We are on Apple devices and when we would use the app we frequently got the message that we were not connected to our Wi-Fi network. So therefore, we could not use the app to do maintenance on the router. The only thing that seemed to work was deleting the app and logging in over the Internet. After an exhaustive online search, I found thousands of other people with the same issues. We are still very happy with our router and satellite but this app is trash.

title: Football Secondary
text:
The Orbi Mesh System is like a great football teams secondary. If you’re throwing the ball downfield you have defenders providing coverage. Doesn’t matter where you throw the ball, there’s coverage. That’s the Orbi! I have a 4500 SF home and I use to have gaps with network coverage throughout my home. Now I have complete coverage anywhere I go inside and I also have about a 30ft diameter of coverage outside as well. Last year I purchased the Xfinity Pods from Comcast that was supposed to do the same thing as the Orbi. Let’s just say I had gaps in my secondary like Swiss Cheese. 

The Orbi is a game changer and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who’s looking for great coverage!

title: Great so far
text:
I purchased an Orbi Mesh AC3000 and CM1150V modem because I’m nerd and I wanted to save money on my Xfinity bill. I wanted to see how it would compare against my homemade mesh set up as well. It’s great so far. I really like the Bit Defender integration and Disney Circle. The app offers a lot information but I want and need more. I’d like to be able to assign devices to a family member or to the house in general. Then I would like to be able to simply turn off or on the family profile thereby controlling all devices assigned to that person. So if I assign a PS4, Wii and iPhone to my son, I want to just put his profile to sleep and all his devices are then blocked until I say. Make sense?

I’m happy with it so far though.

title: Great app and system - with one little flaw
text: The app works great and provides a lot of power into the Orbi system. The router and satellites are amazing and I have easily been able to configure with 3 different ISPs. The only gripe I have is the data transfer monitor page in the app. It was clearly designed as a web page for a computer originally. The text is so small you can’t read it on the bar chart which makes it almost useless. And the units displayed don’t make it simple know what’s actually transferred. If it wasn’t for the overview of data on the dashboard that would be worthless. UI needs updating quick for that page.

title: Buggy app
text: Spending a $1000 plus on a home router then downloading an app that doesn’t work is a huge disappointment. The setup for this device through the app took an hour and a half for something that could have been done in 15 to 30. Ran into a bug app side that stopped the setup process post changing the name and pass making it so I could not see my Orbi Device. Factory reset several times and had to call customer service to get the issue resolved. This whole experience makes me question if I made the right decision in my purchase because if Setup is this difficult, how is managing issues that pop up along the way going to go down. The other thing, just bake the security into the device. I will not and refuse to pay for security on a device that should already come standard with it. Other routers come with security at no cost.

title: Nice interface to my entire home network
text:
Can see all the devices connected to all router inputs, hardwired, 2.4, and 5G networks. Also has a separate guest WiFi connection. Under the connected devices section you can give them an icon to group them into different categories. I’d like to have a custom name so I could assign my garage door openers to it, or maybe they’ll add a garage door icon. I also have a robot lawnmower, and would need an icon for that as well.
I also like the speed test.
I have one remote satellite to cover the other side of my property and I now get a great signal in my bedroom.
All things considered, this is a great product and app.

title: Solved my problem
text: Netgear to the rescue, I have a home with a thick stucco exterior which wouldn’t allow my outdoor nest cams, my car, or nest door bell to connect with a strong signal. Furthermore there were dead spots within my house which gave me trouble with my IOT devices such as lights, cameras, and smart home hubs. My old wireless just didn’t have the through put or range. Problem solved with Orbi, one router and three satellites solved the range problem indoors and out, added slick management features, included device security and plenty of throughput to handle multiple cameras, smart home hubs, media streamers, phones, computers, lights, and other IOT devices. It’s perfect!

title: Nice Improvement, Can't Wait to See What's Next
text:
I was plesently surprised to see this update...I was beginning to get concerned that Netgear may have taken another path, but this update did not dissapoint.  Really like the ability to turn individual devices on and off (I have kids) and the speedtest results are great as I feel like I'm getting a more accurate result (its better then when I test over WiFi).

I'm rating 4 out of 5 as I still feel like some key functionality is missed for a premium device. Specifically, I want the ability to manage parental controls and the ability to set time limts by device.  The web interface works, but it is not a streamlined process.

Keep up the good work.  Looking forward to see whats next.

title: App is great, when it works.
text:
Twice now since having this system the app has lost connection to my Mesh Orbi WiFi 6 router. The internet still works, and runs at lightening speeds, but I can’t control the devices that are running on it. Super frustrating. If I have to factory reset this device every time the app looses it’s connection to the app, then this is gunna have to be sent back. 

I want to like this app, but I can’t in good conscious let the issue of this app breaking give people the impression that this is over a 4.5 star rating app. 

If Netgear would address this issue, along with add a couple other features, like grouping devices to make it easier on the user manage usage, I would give this over a 4 star rating as well. Oh, and this app does NOT have parental controls if you are looking for those.

title: One system for everything
text:
Love the system. We recently moved homes. Switched internet provides. It’s awesome to just plug my own network in and disable the provider wifi networks. Everything works seamlessly. Best of all I have coverage around my house and yard. My smart devices hook up to one network. I don’t have to run to separate networks for 2.4 and 5. 

What would make this product really awesome and 5 star worth is if they expended on the traffic meter and show which device uses how much of the data. For a multi user home and cloud based security camera system, on top of data limits from providers, it would be good to know where the data plan goes

Thanks guys for an awesome product

title: Highly Disappointed
text:
I brought home a new ax4200 with 2 satellites to my three story home. First off setting up over an app instead of the main computer was odd but I went with it. After a few tries and a firmware update, it was a clunky experience, I finally have the system up. I’m a tech person, and was able to figure it out, but I wouldn’t feel good telling my friends or family to do this. 
Short version, my speeds have dropped, my range has dropped and the wi-if seems to drop off every few minutes. 
I am now packing it back up to return. I had hoped the reviews were wrong or the anomaly, but they were not. I don’t need a system that gets constant updates they may or may not cripple my network. 
I had high hopes. Oh well, guess my 10yr old Apple Airport is still the king.

title: Very fragile and frustrating setup process
text: The app would work great if everything goes on happy path, but you’d need extreme patience if anything goes wrong in the middle. You’d need to tirelessly restart the modem and the routers many times, and the app would start at the very first step the whole time, no matter where you have reached. To beginners, remember to unplug the satellites too if your app asks you to reboot the router, otherwise you’ll spend hours wondering why it could not find the device, just like me. After spending hours on the setup and finally got it working, it was a storm of “vulnerability scan” notifications. The app would give you one notice literally for each device on your network. It was super user unfriendly. I just deleted the app completely to discontinue this nightmare.

title: Easy and fast way to fix WiFi dropout issues
text: Replaced 8yr old Netgear device that worked fine until we changed to streaming services.  So, if you have drop-out issues, and use a router to boost coverage, consider upgrading to a mesh capable router and satellites.  Lots of online help to review and learn.  We are retirees, and only know enough to be dangerous.  Netgear Orbi configurations were easy to understand and scalable.  We got the AC2200, w/one satellite.  Keep your old network running, follow instructions to download app on your smartphone.  You won’t believe how easy it is to follow right down to naming your network and running a speed test.

title: Replaces AirPort Extremes and Express
text: Although I’ve been generally satisfied overall with my Apple AirPort Extreme 6th gen, extended in bridge mode by an Extreme 5th gen and Express for years, the coverage on one end of my house was noticeably weaker/slower than in other parts. Also, from time to time airplay over the network would get choppy.  I decided to go with a mesh solution, and I am very pleased so far regarding excellent speed and coverage of Wi-Fi in the house with the RBR50 and one satellite. I like both the iOS app and the web browser interface in order to manage the Orbi LAN. The set up was straightforward and easy.  I especially like all the detailed info about what is going on in the network.

title: I have 2 satellites and a modem working well
text:
I had to reach a leak detector system in a basement
