And an irrigation controller outside in my greenhouse.
My office modem is at the wrong end of the house for all that.
The Orbi connected both devises to my delight. And they have been working smoothly for 7 months without a hitch.
Hence they deserve 5 stars. It did what they said it would.

Recently I ordered an extra satellite to give me better coverage on a different floor. Just hooked it up and think it’s working.
I am checking that by the bars on my Orbi in my IPhone.
I think I managed installing my devices better than the average person both times. I have the APP..........
The instructions are detailed but so many details.
I hope the equipment will get simpler for the users, I will have to call and ensure my latest addition is functioning correctly.
If you are not in IT it becomes a daunting.
I can’t fault the instructions but there are clearly written instructions on clearly written instructions. Folded into instructions

title: Not so much this app, but.....
text: The Orbi app isn’t so much the problem for me, but the router itself and the Circle App that is touted with it. If you didn’t know when you bought the router, you’ll soon find out there is random frequency designation so you cannot assign specific equipment to operates on frequencies it is best utilized at. As a result, cameras which should be running at 2.4 GHz get randomly assigned to 5 GHz and thus drop out frequently. What’s the purpose of having two operating frequencies if you can’t set the devices you use on them? NetGear says they make a router which enables that ability, but you can’t extend the range on that equipment. Wow, get a clue. And the Circle App? Any security software where the administrator can be kicked out and subsequently not allowed access to even attempt to login is absolute crap.

title: Wifi speed significantly slowed down for no reason
text: Been using Orbi rbr50 for 3 years and for the most part been happy with it in terms of speed and performance. But recently the wifi speed have inexplicably gone no faster than 120mbs. I have 900mbs service and wired speed has been in upper 800s mbps. Wired speed hasn’t changed but wifi is suffering. And this is without making any settings changes in the last 2 years. The only factor has is the latest update of 2.7.something. I cannot figure out the issue and there’s seems to be no solution offered. I’ve already done all the settings changes in the past to optimize speed and those still hold true today. It’s frustrating.

title: Great but flawed
text:
Just finished my installation. Whole house mesh is great. The problem I found was quality. First the internet cat 5 cable in the box was bad. A 2 dollar part at the heart of the system. Next, one of the three power supplies was bad. I had replacements from my previous Nighthawk router. For all Netgear’s talk I can’t find a way to talk to them easily about warranty replacement.
And to look back, this is the second   Netgear router I’ve replaced after 2 years of beautiful performance. Even still, I’d buy a Netgear again today if I needed another. I hope somebody is helped by my experience and this review.

title: Should’ve bought the Velop
text:
Just bought the Orbi AC3000 and struggled to find the right app in the App Store.  I searched Netgear Orbi and it didn’t show up, but the packaging directions told me to search this.  Searching just Orbi found it.  Already off to an amazing start. Next I get it going and had to restart the app as it froze.  Could’ve been a lost internet connection so I cut some slack.  Four tries later and I get near the end and it tells me my router is not supported in the app.  I tried again after resetting the router and hit the same error.  It then gives me a button to go to a website to setup my router.  Well I’ve been trying for the past 3 hours and I can’t seem to complete the setup. Netgear told me to use the app in the directions that came with the box.  

Netgear, I’ve been happy with your switches, but this is an experience I’ll never forget.  Thanks for ruining my Saturday night.

title: Best Network Ever
text:
My family has tried several different networks and range extenders over the years.  For some reason, no network provided sufficient coverage throughout the house. We decided to try one more time and went to BestBuy and asked about Orbi. The salesman said it was a good system and advised we get 1 satellite so the 2 could mesh and provide full coverage in the home. 

We took his advice and have never regretted it. Our network is never juggy and works great out to the street in front of the home. Orbi has been the best network ever in our home. 

There is no going back to any other network!

title: Orbi 852 Router and one Satellite
text: I have worked on computer networks for many years so my setup time was less than 25 minutes but it was very easy when following instructions in the Orbi app.  I am totally amazed how I am now getting nearly 100% of my ISP’s full circuit bandwidth throughout my large home.  But I did connect one tv, two desktop computers, and the Arlo security cameras host via cat6 network cables to the Orbi host and satellite.  So glad the satellite has the awesome backhaul wireless band for I didn’t want to run a long network cable to connect it with the Orbi host router.  This is day one but I am so happy with this setup.

title: Confusing, puzzling messages
text:
I get a notice leering me know that “ORBI just detected a new device connected to your network” and when I check I get an alphanumeric MAC: address. What am I supposed to do with that? What device? What’s the notice about if the device cannot be identified by someone without a degree in IT?  I also see other alerts along these lines: “we stopped a threat”. Wham I check the app, “no, no problem at all, all good, nice, all clear, no threat to share”, etc. what? And on the iPad, no landscape mode. What? Hello? More: once a week or so I have to login again to the router because… ?? 
Nice looking devices but the app is not even close to be a replacement to the old Apple Airport app (yes, it had its own bugs but this Orbi app wins the prize). I’m utterly disappointed with the shoddy implementation…

title: Not the best
text: Bought this almost a year ago. It can’t keep up with the download speeds or upload speeds on a consistent basis. The satellite is glitchy at best. It takes a while to recognize new devices added to the network. I would think by 2020 someone would be on their A game with home WiFi and security. AND DON’T waste any money on Circle. I have 2 kids who game and with COVID have done online schooling. I had to shut down Circle because they couldn’t access school materials or even get on Minecraft (with the settings allowing for MInecraft). For them to do their Google based work I had to set the settings to Adult settings - which defeats the whole purpose of having Circle.  NOT HAPPY and NOT keeping up with demands.

title: Was excited & hopeful
text:
I was so excited when I purchased the new NETGEAR Orbi WiFi Router because of the square feet coverage that would fit our house perfectly & with a large family. The instructions looked relatively easy to follow,  either with the app or from the website. Everything was good with my smartphone connection. However, when I tried to connect my iPad, I encountered many roadblocks which then halted my progress with the connection of the laptop, another tablet & a printer. It took too much time trying to figure everything out & searching in the trouble shoot section. Unfortunately there was not a phone number to call for to help me fix all the problems that I had with my set up. I was not even able to perform a firmware update. 
I’m going back to my old router because I could talk with a live person to help me trouble any problems I might encounter.

title: Disappointing
text:
Bought the Orbi recently. It’s not cheap but I was hoping I was paying for a system I could setup, configure for good coverage, and never think about again.

It’s been disappointing. The forums are full of people trying to figure out which version of the firmware is stable, and whether some promised feature (like the Ethernet backhaul) works reliably or not.

The software feels wobbly. The app is relatively slow to connect to the router and report on its condition. The router itself needs to go through a slow reboot for configuration. When you reboot the router, you need to physically unplug the satellite unit and wait minutes to plug it in again, in order to be sure changes are propagating to the satellite. 

When you run the app, it tries to get you to sign up and pay regularly for a Disney content protection service.

Also, this latest version of the iOS app seems to require you to create and login with a Netgear account, in order to do anything. This is rather ironic, considering that one selling point of this system is that it was supposed not to require any interaction with cloud services to operate.

I wish the thing would just work quickly and reliably and get out of the way.

title: We Love Orbi!!
text: We LOVE Orbi!! We have a very old stone home with thick stone walls that no other system could penetrate. We bought 2 years ago and we added a satellite and recently bought Orbi Voice. We even bought an Orbi router for friend as a gift. I work out of our house and we have 2 gamer sons that use the Orbi network it’s the best!! Nothing worked until Orbi!!  We have had our Orbi system for over a year and we have never had any problems with it. We have a 300 year-old stone house and with Orbi we have WIFI everywhere even in rooms we never thought we would get Wifi. It is so fast Orbi is the best!! Thank you!

title: Hardware is good, but everything else is terrible
text:
Bought an orbi mesh at Costco with 18 month support although now orbi only shows 12 months of support. One day my Netgear credentials stop working (no i didn’t forget them, I have a password manager) and have to go through the most asinine process to reset them. Once I finally get through that nonsense I now have to enter a router password that I never had to use before. The orbi app always redirected to the router. So now I have to go through their instructions to reset the router password. The url they instruct me to navigate to doesn’t render properly in Firefox, chrome or safari; gives me 500, 404 and 400 http errors. 

I decide to give support a call but looks like it’s backed up for hours due to covid. 

Looks like I’ll have to spend the next couple of hours doing a full reset.

title: Orbi rocks the house with solid wi-fi on one network!
text: The inside of my home has brick block walls, adobe walls, 90 degree turns down long rambling hallways that had been inaccessible to the wi-fi signal previously. About 4 years ago, I purchased a wi-for signal booster, which helped somewhat , but required an inconvenient reconnect to the booster’s “network “, and still didn’t give us whole house coverage, “dead zones” remained and signal strength diminished in areas the booster accommodated. This year I wanted to install a home security system, and its numerous “smart devices” require excellent internet. Orbi delivers!  The technology carries the wi-fi internet through the home electrical wires.

title: Should have bought the RBK53S first
text: I’ve been fighting for decent WiFi signals in my home for years. I have a u-shaped ranch style home with the center all dual-glazed treated windows. Booster with the arias cable modem couldn’t cover the house. Last year I bought the RBK22 which has the router and 1 satellite.... totally functional with occasional drops due to low flying commercial aircraft... What a huge improvement with the RBK53 with a larger antenna and 2 satellites.... easily handles the 10 currently active devices at twice the throughput.... I would recommend this system... I can securely work from home during this Covid issue

title: App okay. Hard to use at times
text:
Logging into this app is difficult. They added finger print so that should make it easier.  Previously it lacked a remember me. 

And why does it keep prompting to enable remote management?   Isn’t that the number 1 attack vector?  The one thing all security experts tell you to shut off 

It would be nice if updates applied themselves and it was easier to determine the version of the satellites too. Is everything up to date?  One screen. Less tapping around.   So far I’ve had to use my PC to manually install updates on the satellite.  

Those are the cons.

Pros.  Easy to share access. The barcode is easy. Wow.  Great job. I like seeing the devices attached to the network.  The UI is fairly clean. It looks nice - which I think helps navigation. 

It does all the general stuff really well. The advanced stuff is difficult. But I’d be happy with a more heads up display rather than “what’s behind door #3?” Tile design 

Oh. And the traffic meter. Nice feature. Difficult to understand.  Some of the averages don’t make sense. And it would be nice if it tracked more whole months back in time - to align with how my ISP monitors.

title: Mediocre product, terrible reliability, absolutely horrific customer support
text: When and I emphasize WHEN Orbi works, it’s a good product. Problem is it works properly roughly 2/3 of the time. I own five satellites in two states. So the other 1/3 of the time, good luck with tech support. I don’t care what racial implications it has, if your tech support people cannot speak the language of the people who buy your products, they should not be taking tech support calls. When I have a rep saying “B as in Beeter” and clearly. Cannot even pronounce a “P”... we have an issue. THIS is why Americans hate dealing with Philippines-based call centers. You think you’re speaking clear English, but you can’t even say the alphabet properly. I spent 12 minutes on the phone trying to get the rep to understand the serial number. Should have taken 14 seconds. I hung up. I give up. Crap company, crap service.

title: Great product, Terrible support.
text: Product is excellent.  But I have had nothing but headaches trying to get support.  I had just a question, so I was going to use chat.  (Well within two months after purchase.)  Documentation was so unclear about how to do it that I finally called the support number. Oh boy!  The company has outsourced support and the guy I got had such a heavy accent, that along with my hearing problem, I kept having to ask him to repeat.  He tried to guide me through the process of getting chat, but it didn’t work.  The support program is buggy.  I then tried to send an email.  I sent it weeks ago, and they have never answered.    Netgear has the absolute worst support I’ve ever experienced.

title: Awesome product
text: We were large two-story home. We tried other extenders but always had issues with our Internet service in certain locations within the house. We bought this product at Costco about a year ago. With Covid and everybody being, it was a very big problem with the dead spots in our home. We bought this unit and it has worked fantastic for us ever since. We can go any room on any floor of the house and have great Internet reception now that we installed this. I would highly recommend this product. It’s work great for us.

title: Orbi is problematic and the app is very limited
text:
Orbi (router with 1 satellite) is fast and generally works. However, and this is a very big point, Orbi has trouble loading some websites/apps due to some bug in authentication/security. For example, ESPN doesn’t load more than half the time I try. This is a very frustrating issue that could be resolved by moving to a combined WAP2/WAP3 security setting, but that is apparently harder than it seems. It gets resolved when issuing only WAP3, but many devises around the house won’t work with that setting, so that’s not a solution. 

Also, the app is disturbingly limited. You can only pause a devise on the network (essentially turn it on or off). You can neither schedule a devise nor the wifi to turn off/pause at set times. I have teenagers and this feature, which is available in other systems, would be very useful. 

Netgear says it’s working on fixes, but it’s been years and nothing so far. 

I’d consider competitor systems if you want less bugs and limitations.

title: Please Fix App
text:
I will update this later when the issue is fixed. If you set up your Orbi Pro on the web… and change your admin name… you cannot access the “name” field to change from the default “admin” to your admin name. Kind of surprised this slipped through, but it happens each time I try to log in. I cannot change the default admin name, so obviously I cannot log in any further.

Also, please make a link to report bugs like this. I hate leaving bad reviews, and I will change and update this once this bug gets fixed. Hopefully somebody will look at this and start sending the way do to the correct person to fix.

Other than the app, I really do like the Orbi Pro system. Looking forward to trying out the app once I can change the name from the default “admin” to my admin name.

title: Works perfect.  Disconnect teenagers with a simple slide to off
text: Love it.  Can’t sleep because kids are to noisy? Staying up to late?  Spending all day on the internet?  Simply swipe “off” and devices are disconnected.  Also you can set up access times.  Works exactly as expected and has got to be the best mesh network out their.  Run cameras from garage, son has blazing fast internet due to satellite and hard wire (being upstairs from the main router) the satellite is awesome!  We run Roku, Apple TV, etc from every room of the house and mobile and fixed devices connect accordingly based on signal strength.

title: Easy to use, but a lot of notifications
text:
I’ve always found the Netgear apps easy to use, and this one is no different. Setting up the Orbi was a breeze and it has all the basic functionality to maintain it. 
My only complaint is the number of notifications you get from the Netgear Armor. It lets you know every time it blocks a harmful email or text, and, although, I appreciate its diligence, I wish I could turn off the pop-up notifications just for this. In this day of constant phishing attempts, I don’t need to know every time you stopped that email from the prince in Nigeria, who has left me a large inheritance.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: I have a 2-floor 5,000 sq ft home with finished basement that is twice as wide as deep.  Bought the base package and an additional 2 satellites as I expected to need satellites on each floor.  Was pleasantly surprised when the router and one satellite on the main floor gave 180mb wireless in most spots with a low of 80mb in the most remote corner upstairs - more than the comcast rated 150mb.  Luckily I started with just the router and one satellite leaving the 2 additional satellites unopened, so I was able to return both of the extra satellites I bought.  Very simple to setup in 30 minutes.  Spent more time applying 3 firmware updates to both the router and one satellite.

title: Sattelites show offline
text:
I am not sure if this is a bug with the app or the firmware or something else. I have an Orbi system with one satellite. The satellite toggles between green and pink consistently (offline and online). It’s also a wired connection and quite a stable one at that. Tested it myself. Also the connection to the satellite is inconsistent. It’s almost like somehow the firmware is crashing and recovering constantly. Can’t make out what’s going on. At times when I return home my devices connected to the Satellite is offline.  

Also the opposite is true as well. Clicking on the satellite on the app sometimes shows offline when it actually isn’t (devices are connected thru Ethernet)

Please fix this.

title: WiFi for the rest of Us
text: I set off for a different model to upgrade an antique WiFi router. As I headed to the door my non technical sister said we have an Orbi and I set it up all by myself. Hmmmm I was skeptical until my B-I-L said he has WiFi with an Orbi and it’s 1 Satellite and it covers his 4000 sqft house AND he has perfect signal poolside. Great I said and still tried to look it up but I misspelled Orby :-) So I showed up at Walmart and went to the router case and lo and behold the Orbi was next to my first choice but $10 cheaper so I bought it and man are we happier than ever. I highly recommend the Orbi with no CONS to the review.

title: Great Router
text: I bought this router about 4 years ago to help with signal strength in my home where the modem/router combo was set up in the basement. Signal would drop off, so I got an extender which was not much help. I did my research and found that Netgear had a tri-band router with satellites and that it maintained the signal strength with the extra band. It’s been great!! I bought the Netgear CM1000 to go with it after some time. It’s great!! You don’t need to be tethered to the router to get the internet speeds the companies say you get. The satellite has ports on the back to connect other devices which is great and a must have.

title: Security app looks good but scam.
text: Enrolled in the security program near the end of the trial. They took my money and the service is expired. Tried chat and waited almost an hour and closed it out. Sent in a ticket - the email said I needed to call support or the ticket would be archived. Called support and waited quite a while to waste about 15 minutes with a service rep that said they were transferring me to someone who would help resolve and then I sat there for over 20 minutes and no transfer.   I have other questions but service is looking like it’s weak and not going to help.

title: Orbi Review
text: So far we’ve only had it a week. We’ve had older model Netgear devices router, modems, WiFi booster extenders. And are now becoming obsolete I guess. So we were torn between the mesh systems the Google and the Orbi. We heard more highlights about Orbi so we went with Orbi. We have a big house and we’re only getting good WiFi steady in our living room and near it then you’d get it in other places throughout the house but just was steady and good. So far so good with Orbi. Was easy to install and I will say to get all blue rings for super good mesh hold the satellite up in the air and towards the main for excellent sync to the main. Then position it where you want.

title: Loving Orbi WiFi Mesh So Far!
text: Just updated our WiFi system to the Orbi Triband whole home mesh system. (RouterRBR40 & 2 Satellites RBS20). Amazing as it was so easy to install-approx 10 min and that was more letting Orbi do all the work!  They have an app that literally walks you through the procedure. I choose to use the same network name etc as I used before so all my devices would automatically reconnect. Then voila my internet worked and worked amazingly well. So far just very impressed as it’s been along time that I’ve had a product install and work so effortlessly!!! Thank you Orbi!!

title: Great whole home WiFi system!
text: Very easy to setup and use, great coverage too! I switched from Linksys WiFi extender for my little over 2000sf house. The WiFi extender does not provide good coverage and I need to switch SSID manually to get better signal depending where I am in the house, the Orbi system only has one SSID for multiple bands and switches automatically. I put the satellite on the second floor and whenever I test the speed I can get over 100 mbps vs just less than 10 mbps from Linksys extender. So I’m very happy that I made the purchase. As for the Netgear App, it provides many way to manage the network and easy to use.

title: App screenshots are dishonest
text:
The router seems ok so far, but every scrap of software related to this project is unstable. Oddly enough, every release of the app or firmware seems to get more unstable and user-hostile. 

So many rough edges in a system that has been out this long. And the irony is that so many of the problems seem to have been created by netgear itself in pursuit of new revenue streams (I’m looking at you Armor and Circle) while ignoring core functionality, usability and promised features. 

And I am still annoyed that the app screenshots in the App Store are not from the actual app. Device management in reality is extremely limited (there’s no such thing as a “PlayStation” icon or a user defied device type) and there are screens showing features that simply do not exist.

title: Want device specific consumption
text: This app is certainly useful in some ways. My most favorite feature is the ability to enable and disable each Wi-Fi connected device - useful in a variety of ways. What I don’t have, and why I don’t give this app 5 stars, is the ability to understand which devices are sucking up the most bandwidth. There’s assumptions I can make, but sometimes the seemingly low bandwidth devices are the ones causing me trouble. But if I could review data consumption by device against time, I’d be  able to better identify problem devices. Better yet, I’d like Orbi to automatically detect bandwidth utilization across my devices and keep them balanced!

title: Be better
text:
At the price point(for the system) you would think the app and support would be better. The system isn’t terrible and better then what I had but; I thought I could replace my existing router. Turns out I couldn’t. That is on me. 
I contacted customer service about some issues with the app and did get a response. Uninstall and reinstall 🙄 
Didn’t have much time so I left it with them that I would do what was asked and be in contact. Tried to contact them several times since and have received no response. Had to resolve part of my issue myself through online searches and am still waiting to find out why my app can no longer tell me what devices are what AND cannot even pause to Whittle it down for myself like some crappy i.t. Sherlock. 

I would expect at the price point that the support/app would be better.

title: Orbi system great! iOS app could use some improvement.
text:
I'm really impressed with the Orbi mesh system. The iOS app allowed me to set it up, including the two satellites, without a hitch.

I would, however, ask for two things: 1) the included speed test measures internet speed, not the speed of the WiFi at the location of the device. When placing the satellites, I used a third party speed test app to find the best location within our house. It would be nice if the Orbi app did that. 2) the app makes it hard to identify the devices connected to the WiFi. When I used the Xfinity xFi app (good app, bad mesh network), when new devices connected, it was easier to determine what device it was.

Other then these suggestions, nice job, Netgear.

title: Netgear setup
text: If everything goes well, it’s probably a five star review. I had to manually configure a few things because the setup breaks in the middle, when setup cannot handle the exceptions. Just one example, when i configured the name of the router to match my previous one. It took the name into the router but at the next step my phone is set on not connecting to the new router name and stay at LTE... it does this loop twice before I intervened and force feed the process. Need more work in the setup to handle exceptions. There were Two Exceptions in my setup. Just mention one fyi.

title: Terrible support
text: First off I’ll start by saying that their mesh system worked fantastic for about a year and a half...now it’s nothing but issues. I updated the firmware and now my router disconnects at least 2-3 time per day. In order to get it to reconnect I have to reboot the system each time, which is annoying. You’d think I’d be able to reach out to customer support and get quick and easy help with resolving the issue...nope. They only offer a 1 year warranty and 90 day tech support, after that they just tell you to visit their community support website to look for help. I’ve done everything I’ve read to do so far and nothing helps. It’s probably a simple fix if I could just talk to the tech support people, but I can’t because it’s past the 90 days. Ridiculous.

title: New update turns easy to painful ...
text:
I have had the Orbi router/ satellite at the house for a couple of years now. They have always worked well and their handoff from one to the other is great when moving around the house. But ... this latest update to the app turns something that used to be easy into something painful. After installing the new updated app the device management screen rapidly became frustrating. Not only did they take what used to be a simple screen into complex. On top of that you get this list of any device that has ever been on your network. The result is that you now have to scroll up and down to find the one device you want to adjust. 

Please rethink this and return to simple.

title: Impressive Hardware
text:
I finally decided to invest in a system that would  be reliable and be able to stream high definition video. After a thorough research and reading a ton of reviews, I decided to go for Orbi. I simply needed something that would easily handle my 300mbps internet speed throughout my 3000 sq foot house, three story house. The hardware is superior to anything I’ve ever experienced. There is no loss of signal whatsoever in any part of the house and I can’t say I set up the router and the satellites in perfect spots. 
I’m not really concerned with software or the app, I just wanted a highly reliable router system. And this was it for me!

title: Great When it Works!
text: Problem is when the app stops working, you have to reset your entire network to gain access to the app again. No updates will allow it to communicate again.   It would be nice if the loss of connectivity did not require the entire resetting of your network.  App also needs to have more advanced settings.  Overall, if your needs are basic, it has a lot of controls that are easy for your network. If the hardware doesn’t glitch, it works miracles for your network. I have uverse and it has worked seamless. Just reset the At&t router first and wait for internet connectivity, before you connect it to the Orbi router.

title: Cannot login locally to router?
text:
I am very security conscious, and barely does a day pass where another companies security has been compromised and customer information is leaked. Consequently, I do not setup online accounts with direct access to my home network, and neither should anyone else.   Regarding this new app, Netgear requires an online account to be set up even though in the past and on the previous app it was not necessary.   In and of itself this isn't too much of an issue when using a ddns and vpn service, whereas I can still log into the local admin web access while onsite and off site. 

I am not saying the new app is bad, however it seems odd that previous features where removed, and now the new app has at least one less feature.

title: Very impressed
text:
You know, I have tried multiple routers that claim to increase speed and mitigate WiFi interference. I live in a neighborhood, so the houses are close. I had a huge problem with network reliability and interference. Ever since switching to Orbi, I don’t have a long problems. I am very…very impressed with the network reliability. I went from speeds of 220 mpbs to 900 mbps+. Great product and highly recommend to anyone struggling with WiFi reliability and latency issues. 

P.S. lose the default gateway provided by the ISP and use this to replace it. I’m telling you…. Well worth it!

title: Disappointed
text: So, Netgear should really work with their marketing team, their website implies that their new Orbi wifi 6 routers world with parental controls (circle) when they’re not compatible; that is such a nasty tactic. On top of that, this app is incredibly slow and buggy; I have had to restart my router multiple times for the app to work and it hasn’t even been a week since I got the routers. Their app doesn’t allow for profiles or schedules, I am certainly not going to be pausing and resuming devices manually while scrolling through so many devices. The internet speeds are good, I’ll give them that, but outside of this and for the price of the Orbit routers this is just trash. I will be switching to Eero 6 Pro (my old eero routers worked much better) and returning the Orbi ones.

title: App Won’t recognize new subscription
text: I bought a one year subscription in early July and STILL in September cannot access or use it.  The software won’t restore the armor functions that existed during my free trial. I called support, and after being on hold over an hour, spoke with a tech who told me to reset my router and reload the app.  That should give me the version of the app that includes the extra subscription features.  It did not.  I have tried repeatedly.  Why can’t your own software easily accommodate new and upgraded subscriptions!?  You would think your newest paying customers would be your highest priority!  I am paying a high subscription rate for nothing!  If your app software is this ineffective it makes me question the competence of your core security software.

title: The Router is ok. But the app is buggy
text: There is problem with updating router firmware from the app. I have to use the computer to update it. There is problem with displaying network map. It's been a hit and miss. Sometimes it just show no devices attached to router or satellite. I have to back out and try it again. It doesn't displaying the wifi signal meter for satellite so that I know if the positions of my satellites is a good one. The RBR50 seems to give me the strongest Wi-Fi coverage over other mesh routers, but it the configuration and flexibility is less. It would be nice if I can manually assign my devices to connect to whichever nodes have the strongest wifi signal. Orbi connect most of my devices to the router with 2.4 instead of 5 GHz even thought I have satellite installed like 10 feet away.

title: New Orbi (2 satellite system)
text:
Just installed my new Orbi 2 satellite system and so far so good.  Fast speeds.  It did take a little longer to set system up than I thought.  The system had issues finding wifi network had to search a few times disconnect cellular from phone back and forth until it found and connected.  Hopefully that won’t be an issue going forward.  Also it took a couple attempts doing nothing different on my side except trying again to update firmware.
Day one of hopefully thousands with my Orbi.

title: Terrible UX. Always forgets credentials
text:
This app is terrible even before you can start using it. It doesn’t retain my credentials and I always have to go through the 2FA login flow EVERY SINGLE TIME it’s been more than a few days since I logged in. That’s practically every time I need to access the router to do periodic tasks like perform updates or restarts.

The lack of user friendliness makes me realize that it may not be worth sticking with Orbi for the next router update when I update to Wifi 6. Netgear/ Orbi are only investing in this app to try to milk subscription revenue out of users by upselling add ons most people don’t need instead of making the owner experience better. The number one job for the app should be to make it easier to use the web based admin page. It fails to do that, miserably.

title: know the total cost of ownership
text:
the reviews don’t say that when you buy, you will end up having to pay (later after warranty and support expire) an outrageous amount to contact support, get security capabilities that were free at purchase. and the app is RELENTLESSLY trying to
sell. 

i purchased two mesh systems for two homes. i called support once.I’ve been having nothing but problems with Apple HomePods likely some combination of the two companies,But I can’t even contact support not by phone or by email I’m welcome to search the Internet. 

When I make my next purchase Netgear, listen to me I will not purchase from you. And I will do my homework on the total cost of ownership because what you’re doing is a bait and switch  for recurring revenue.

If you support the model you should be upfront and just charge a recurring revenue from the start but you get the money for the hardware and then you get the money for the service is recurring.

I pay for a service that I enjoy that I want to have that adds value. Any business that prevents the customer from talking to them and tries to charge them to speak with them is making a mistake.

title: Orbi is out of this world!
text: I have a technical background and have set up home networks as well as office networks for the past 15 years. I have purchased and used no less than 15 routers during that time and Orbi is the best solution ever for extended and stable WiFi connections. No more access points and WiFi extenders! Orbi provides almost identical WiFi signals and speeds through out my 2600 sq ft home. Both up and down stairs and even on the patio with no latency or annoying buffering. I will never go back to the old router technology as it is already obsolete...

title: Almost works as shown on App Store
text:
Just purchased new orbi, downloaded iOS app and it's missing several widgets that are supposed to be in the latest version, like first wifi, Speedtest etc. Deleted and downloaded it again. So basically it shows me my network is connected, I already know that!

August 2, 2017- well I must say I'm impressed with the customer service, got a really prompt reply which let me know that the firmware will make the update and now all of the widgets are available. Going to four stars now, would go five but I would like to have the ability to see exactly what network band my devices are connected to 2.4 G or 5G etc.

title: Very disappointed
text: I bought the Orbi router and associated software just over a year ago. Recently, Netgear pushed hard on a 3rd party security update that was part of the installation. I paid the $40 annual subscription for the update, installed it but kept getting consistent errors that the installation couldn’t complete. When I tried to contact Netgear, I found out ALL of their support options (phone, chat and text) required a separate annual subscription. So now I’ve paid $40 for an update recommended by Netgear that won’t install and my only option is to pay them more so they can help fix a crappy product. Fortunately there are many other options that perform as well and offer better service.

title: Easy setup, strong signal and fast internet
text: I typically first read the negative reviews. It appeared that most of these folks had random failures e.g. shipping problems, defective units etc. So I decided to give this a try because I was buying it from Costco and I knew that I can easily return if the system didn’t meet my expectations. The setup is so simple that the box doesn’t even come with any instructions other than - “down load the app and follow instructions”. Once I did that the whole process took less than 15 mins and I have blazing fast internet everywhere in my 3300 sq ft home! I had been using google wifi mesh (the first gen). That thing was a joke and I am trying to figure out how to get my money back.

title: Not much changed
text: Set up was relatively easy. Previous router was Netgear Nighthawk. Nighthawk was decent system, but wanted to improve coverage. So far, extra $300 showing  marginal improvement, nothing like what’s marketed. WiFi shows satellites working, but signal strength to wireless cameras shows no improvement for signal what’s. Not much written material to go by, other than setup instructions. Support is mostly community forum, which I’ve found not relevant.  I have written to Netgear several times, asking for recommendations or advice. Nothing. Netgear phone support is difficult to reach as they are insulated from public and have long wait times. I have another week to determine if the ORBI10 is worthy to keep, if not; most likely will return to BestBuy, who’s also not been much help. Disappointing.

title: Very happy with my Orbi system over 2 years later
text: Way better than anything we ever had in past, all the higher end NetGear routers. Ditched the Comcast modem as well at same time. Just the modem alone sped up my throughout and I've not had to ever call back in for any issues. I was constantly having to reset the router/modem; several times weekly at times. This system is many times faster, super easy to navigate and set up as well as control who does what on the network. Great system, everything over could expect.

title: Needs improvement
text:
After buying and retuning three different mesh systems, I’m now trying Orbi.  Setup using the app was not the greatest.  It said to wait for the satellites to turn white, my units never did.  After an hour or so, I was able to get the system working.

2/3rds of the time, the system works.  However sometimes I’ll see a significant slow down or everything just stops working. I have to wait a minute and it back to normal.  I also tried changing the names of the satellites and they always revert back to their setup names.  It really annoying.

I’ll wait a weeks and if nothing works to my likings, I’m going back to the Google WiFi mesh system.  It was a bit slower, but I did not have any issues at all.  Plus the app was way better.

title: App is clueless
text: This app seems to get lost in itself. The app tells me there is an update. I run the update, but then I get an error message saying it failed. I press the update button again and again I get an error message that says it failed. I go out of the app, I reset my phone, I go back in and hit update and it updates. it reboots the modem, I wait five minutes to reconnect my phone and it says I cannot connect to the Orbi. I close the app and then I go back into the app and it’s connected. This happens every time I run the firmware update. So did it update or not??? it seems like this app doesn’t know what itself is doing, gets lost and easily confused. Scary that the app can’t operate correctly while communicating with its very own hardware. Netgear should do better, ALOT BETTER!

title: Updates painful
text:
App blows up automated login every new update these idiots do! Stop that! 
So what does “blow up” mean? No support for a change that continues to take me to the  “issues connecting with network” and along with 3 circular undesirable choices. 1) try again 2) reinstall whole system 3) log on with anywhere.  Why is this happening and I’m still on the Network. Every path goes in a circular direction. This is ur mess ORBI! Clean it UP!!!! Quit charging customers for service when you make changes that screw up login’s!

Focus on core functionality. Perhaps directing a device from main router to satellite in the app. I’m 4 feet from the satellite and yet mine fails to the router 60 feet away.

Improve ability to mask 5g for certain, selected devices. Cameras, etc.

Improve service accessibility from community to direct help when needed. Very poor marks here! Too much trying to upsell. When someone pays nearly a $1000 for product u need to step up ur service. Until you do your product and service are Nd will be low!

Tons of improvements to be done. But stop kicking me out on sign in and over engineering the UI or backend with such minor changes.

title: Great app, but...
text: I’m new to the Orbi space, but needed a powerful network for my work.  The app looks well laid out visually.  However, I’m a blind user, so visual doesn’t count when I am using a screenreader like VoiceOver on my iPhone and iPad to access the app.  The app is not always intuitive, and is not always read out by the screenreader.  Some areas are presented in a way that is not accessible.  (Most recently, testing network speed.). It would be amazing if Netgear took disabled users into consideration and made this app completely accessible and more user friendly for those of us who rely on screen readers.

title: Doesnt work
text:
The app is pretty pointless besides the fact it doesnt work. When it used to work it basically showed things on your network without any way of knowing what these things are. LG modem? I dont have an LG modem and being that i dont have neighbors i doubt anyone is stealing my wifi. 
The app used to connect. As many users report it will no longer find the router and login. I am literally on the network as i look for the router and it tells me i am not connected. This is not possible. I cant even manually find the router by typing its ip address in my desktop browser so its worse than just the app not connecting.
Login or not at least the wifi works and i am online with all of my devices. Like i said there is zero reason to login into the router anyway.

title: Update - can no longer login to NETGEAR
text: I used to be able to manage kids WiFi usage via Orbi genie. Found out that APP no longer functions & am supposed to be able to access via Orbi-NETGEAR app. Well I cannot. I am stuck in a loop. I have reset password several times & my email is recognized & appears as if password is reset, but when I go to login page keep getting red banner stating invalid password/email. I know that is incorrect. Not sure what I can do at this. I reset modem/router to original settings etc & nada. Never had ANY issues w Orbi genie app & now I cannot access anything w new Orbi-NETGEAR app. Frustrated

title: Setup easy!
text:
Downloaded the iOS app and carefully followed the steps to a successful install! I advise purchasers to patiently follow the steps. Some actions, understandably, take a few seconds while the devices configure themselves. Repeat - seconds! People, like my wife, with zero tolerance for delay, will only frustrate themselves with harmless and needless clicking and swiping. 

We shall soon learn if this new “mesh” network coverage will work as anticipated. We had used an Apple router that worked ok in our 2500 sqft ranch house but did not suffice in our back yard. We hope that a strategically placed satellite will enable us to stream content without lag.

title: Wow!!
text: We had Spectrum (our Internet provider) come out and check the equipment. The WiFi was extremely weak or nonexistent throughout our house. They said that it is the best their Wifi will do considering the size and configuration of our house. The tech recommended a whole house system. I just installed this new Orbi system (base with two remote stations) and our WiFi is screaming fast throughout our house, out in the remote game room, and around the property.  Set up was easy.  I only wish I would’ve done this sooner.  Highly recommend.

title: Have to pay for what was a free feature
text:
I updated to the newest version of the app and the ability to pause and then enable devices from using the internet is now gone. I called tech support today. Because I purchased the RBK753 $600 more than 90 days ago they would not help me fix the problem unless I pay for a year of support. This app has now become ransomware. 

I now have to pay $80 / year, or more, for life for the simple ability to control who is using a piece of equipment that I purchased and own. Netgear advertised this very feature as being included without cost. That was a huge feature for purchasing Netgear over Google. 

Do not purchase Netgear without knowing that you will be nickeled and dimed until you die.

title: Mostly good
text:
I had to have help from Netgear tech support for initial setup, but once it was set, no problems.  Just a few issues:

a. I get messages saying that the Orbi firmware needs updating, but when I follow the instructions, it says my firmware is already up-to-date.  🤔
b.  For iPad, app needs a landscape view. 
c.  I’d like to rename a few of the connected devices and I know how to do that, but the default nomenclature is so obscure for some of them, I don’t know which is which.  That may actually not be the app’s fault, but rather the manufacturer of the connected equipment, but I have no way of knowing.

title: Works as advertised but lacks some convenience
text:
The app was able to get my product installed and configured quickly. Network performance is fantastic but the management app lacks some of the features I’m used to coming from an AmpliFi setup. Reception for devices is strong throughout my house in all corners. 

There’s no features that allows me to see total data throughout or a feature that allows me to do a Speedtest from the router. Both of which I used to ensure my internet provider was giving me the speeds I’m paying for and to see where I am in relation to data caps.

title: Customer apathy
text: I had a terrible experience trying to set up my orbi system with my fiber connection.  Literally hours on the phone between Netgear customer support and my ISP and tons of finger pointing.  Finally got it working and all was grand for several months until I get an email saying a firmware update is required.  Like a lemming, I complied and now it won’t connect again.  Furthermore, as I have not purchased an extra support contract, I am not allowed assistance for the issues caused by the required update. Overall review, good product, distasteful company.

title: Orbi never seems to stay connected!
text:
After setting up my Orbi mesh network, it worked great for about two months. Now Netgear has done about 7-10 updates, and the router constantly loses connection and needs to be rebooted. This is not an upgrade, since the only thing that has occurred since these updates has been constant need to reboot the router. Terrible!!! Would give -5 stars if I could, would give 10 stars if it would only stay connected.

title: Not 100%
text: My Orbi app and maybe my router and satellite is acting crazy today. title: Is it 2018 yet?
text: Replaced a 8 YO Netgear router + wifi extender with an Orbi + 2 “wall plug” satellites combo.  BIG increase in coverage and speed, as expected. This app made initial “basic” configuration and setup (wirelessly!) a snap - and is particularly useful for monitoring the status of and organizing the list of connected devices from your mobile device. title: Router failed

title: Speed to spare
text: I purchased Orbi pro because I have two kids at home “virtual learning “ and a wife working from home. The speed was not enough for three zoom calls plus all the extras.
