I will say you will have to manually update the firmware the first time and reboot after.  Once you update the first manually you can do it from the app. A great product just be patient on the install.

title: Web portal and app don’t sync
text: This app doesn’t sync with the web portal. It tells me that my password is invalid when it isn’t. The iOS app says I’m not connected when the web portal says I am. The iOS app can’t find the satellite when the web portal say it’s there. When I bought Armor, it went fine, but then when the web portal told me t was installed, the iOS app made me go through a whole rigmarole as if installing it all over again. It tells me that 11 devices on my network are Bitdefender-capable, but it doesn’t tell me HOW TO INSTALL IT. Just says “download and install.” From where? To where? Do you have 2 different teams working on these things who never talk to each other? Bad, bad, bad.

title: Updated to Orbi Mesh router-satellite system
text:
Conversion over to the Orbi Mesh router-satellite system was a “piece of cake” if one loads the Orbi App and just follows its’ instructions. I hope our home internet will stay fast and not drop out as we have been experiencing for last 6 mos. I replaced a 9 year old Netgear WNDR3700 RangeMax Dusl Band Wireless-B Gigabit Router. We constantly had to reboot the router to keep the speed up. 

  We’re still using a DSL C2000TV5 Modem from Centurylink and only have 25 mps ISP speed. That’s all that’s available in our area at this time unless I change my ISP provider.

title: ORBI Mobile App by Netgear-a must if you have ORBI WiFi
text: I use mainly Apple machines-from iMacs to iPhones and iPads.  Tried using AirPort Extreme with my WiFi provider, but it just could not handle the volume or the dispersion within my multi-level steel-frame house.  ORBI RBR50 with two satellites has it under control.  The app makes it a snap to manage the home network, check internet speed from service provider and see who’s connected to which ORBI.  The app on iPhone is actually better than on iPad for more capability and ease of use.  BTW, ORBI works fine, but internet service is hit and miss lately.

title: Impressive
text: When Orbi arrived, I opened the box and the first thing I found was a small sheet of paper instructing me to download the app onto my iPhone. Once I downloaded the app, I was taken through the steps necessary to install the system I had purchased (primary unit + 2 satellites). Instructions were crystal clear and the installation was speedy, easy and uneventful. Since the installation, I have had perfect Wi-Fi connection in all parts of my house. Previously, it had been quite spotty in certain areas. I recommend Orbi without hesitation.

title: Good equipment but tech support is not good
text: When I first got the Orbi router and 2 satellites I had connectivity problems...the router kept going offline...when I called back on day 95 I was told the tech support lady could not help me unless I paid $$ for an extended warranty plan...what a hassle...like talking to a brick wall...I was adamant my router was defective...Orbi tech support did not want to talk about my problem unless I paid $$; finally I had to get rude and ask for a supervisor...got the tech support requested...after 45 min.  of troubleshooting the tech lady agreed that my Orbi router was defective and sent me a replacement...now I avoid all Netgear’s products...just needed a new router modem; bought an Arris; no longer have confidence in Netgear’s support.

title: WiFi happy
text:
We have struggled with WiFi coverage since we moved into our new home more than five years ago. 
I purchased a Wilson antenna and other routers adding extenders, repeaters even Nighthawks. Our home is stucco and the wire mesh plus radiant barrier causes so many issues. 
I purchase the Orbi and two satellites in spite of net gears recommendation of using only one satellite to cover our 2900 sq ft one story home. 
At first I thought I would have to buy another satellite to get necessary coverage. If you buy an Orbi just know you may have to tweak it by moving it around to get the best coverage. I had to relocate the router part of it to the central part of the house and position the satellites on each end. 
I am also using Alexa and Smartthings. In order to get things responding and working seamless I had to position the Orbis even a short distance to get just the right balance. 
I’m very satisfied now everything is positioned properly for best coverage.

title: Update: The app is works well for typical users.
text:
Update 2: Can’t use the app again. See the old 1-star review below. Netgear folks: let me use the equipment I paid for. 

Update 1: I am happy to report that you can do “lite” management of the Orbi router system again without a Netgear account. I am back to logging in with only the router device password. Don’t know if this was done by Netgear in response to feedback, but in any case I’m thankful. There are some nice enhancements to the interface that I appreciate too. 

Old 1-star review: With the latest update I’ve lost the ability to use the app. I’m not interested in creating a Netgear account and, it seems, the app will not allow you to skip past creating one. I’m not concerned about missing out on the features an account would enable. They do not interest me.

title: Recent Updates Causing Continued Issues
text:
Over past few months, each time app or router firmware updates, all kinds of new issues come up. Tried restarting/erasing and resetting my 11 pro max, uninstalling and reinstalling app, it crashes 100% of time, it has become useless as I cannot get past login. For past month, main router and satellites drop connections, freeze, and has a continued issue of needing you switch from WiFi to cellular and back to WiFi to work OK again. For the first time in years, my WiFi printer cannot connect to any of the 3 orbis so I had to run a long Ethernet port to get network printing.

Plan to buy a new mesh system during Xmas sales if these problems continue.

Please address the bugs in your recent firmware and app.

title: Be Patient
text: No installation is ever painless. After the Orbi router would not connect to the internet, even though my phone showed a wireless signal on the network, I ended up deleting the Orbi app and downloading a new one. Unplugged and restarted the modem and router. The new app got it all working in five minutes. My original mistake was probably renaming the network during the first effort to set up. Lesson: don’t be creative til you’re done with setup. BTW, old download speed was average of 220mps. New speed is over double that, with same modem. Nice.

title: Intuitive and easy to use
text:
Just got the Orbi AC3000, took all of 20 minutes to set it up and get everything connected. The app was intuitive and easy to use, walked through the setup quickly and easily. 

I realize this review is for the app and not the hardware, but in case anyone is thinking about buying: I’m currently getting over 600 Mbps down in my third-floor office, with the modem sitting on the first floor. With my previous router (a Nighthawk), I was getting barely over 200. Thrilled with both the router and this app.

title: Satellite Sadness
text: I’m very upset at the lack of technical support for the product. It seems to drop off-line frequently and then I have to set everything back up. A couple of times I was totally in capable of restoring things, then a day or two later, haven’t done nothing, things were working again. No idea why! One of the satellites, the closest to the router, simply won’t pair up with anything. The one that I have downstairs, hoping to increase streaming speed for the television, shows that it’s working but doesn’t repeat the signal. Very disappointing.

title: Orbi is wonderful
text: Orbi Won me over very quickly. (Sorry for the word play on Star Wars). Easy to setup and performance is stellar compared to my old router in the basement. Now get full isp speeds all the way to the 3rd floor of a 100 year old brick house plus all of the yard and my detached garage. Had to get used to the higher cost for a base unit and two satellite units but this mesh system really worked for me. Now that I see how well it works, it definitely was value for the money. Even my kids with all their devices now see us as having top level wifi compared to others.

title: Out of the Box Setup
text:
Found a small window when no one was online to get my new ORBI AX6000 up and running. Not only was the setup straight forward, fast, easy it was actually interesting. I am not a techie and was dreading running into issues with the setup but it was so smooth and easy. 

Besides setting up the network and checking out the controls and security it was a breeze to ad back my home controls, SONOS, LUTRON, and all the iPhones, iMacs, and iPads. 

And as Advertised, the speeds are carried through the house.

title: iOS App Is a Failure and Forget About Obtaining Support
text:
The iOS app CONSTANTLY has issues with simply logging in. Error - Try Again. Of course, it’s impossible to contact NetGear for support to find out what’s wrong - credentials work fine from a PC so all fingers point to the app. App fails routinely on 4 different iOS devices so it’s not a single device with issues. Yes. We’ve deleted, rebooted and reinstalled the app. No change. How about making app/account support accessible instead of completely making it impossible to obtain support???? Lack of any support really really makes me want to remove every NetGear product from our gone and find a different vendor!

Then. Firmware update creates an entire new set of issues with satellite connectivity- satellites now have constant stable connectivity issues in the app BUT it appears devices are connected. 🤷🏻‍♂️ Several finds a day, everything WiFi goes offline.

Yes, I’ve done factory reset after factory reset. Same issues return.

This has been this most problematic mesh network I’ve ever installed - and this is not my first!

Not at all worth the price point!

title: Worth it!
text: So I was skeptical on purchasing this product mostly because of the price.  I thought maybe my connection speeds couldn’t be better but wow. I pay for 150 Mbps through my internet provider but the best I could really get using my WiFi was 25-30.  Most of the time is was more like 11-18.  I just checked it and my Download speed was 163 mbps. Worth’s the money. I bought it with 1 satellite and it works perfect. It also tells you when a new device signs into your network.

title: Frustrating, non-intuitive, time sink.
text:
I’ve given this a lot of chances. I really want to like it. 

The app has no real, systematic troubleshooting. It feels stuck in its own stubborn, insistent way of doing things, making the user swipe through pages I don’t really explain anything well. 

The new trouble shooting pages in the latest version are just lame. They’re just not comprehensive at all. Also: small print, broken sentences, no hot links – it’s as if nerdy engineers are attempting customer service, because that’s exactly what is happening. They need to hire some liberal arts grads to translate. 

When the Orbis work it’s been great, but I’ve spent hours over the past two months waiting for the flashing light, the fast then slow flashing white light on the satellite that stays flashing Turn solid blue or maybe turn solid white – who knows? There’s no pattern, and no good explanation. Then when it finally works, the light mysterious drops, the inscrutable and strangely-sequenced pages of the unintuitive app are completely unhelpful.

The app simply needs to be rewritten from scratch with an eye towards usability and common sense. I’m returning this disappointing waste of time.

title: Blown Away!!!
text: I can’t believe how super easy this was to set up!  I downloaded the app on my iPhone went through the instructions and within a minutes I was up and running! Of course, you’ll have to be patient just a little bit while you wait for your modem to start back up because you have to shut that down in the beginning. I now have super fast speed and I’m not getting dropped.  I highly recommend NETGEAR AX6000 RBK853 WiFi6 System to anyone who is working from home!

title: No Devices Found
text: Router works great. Had it for a year now and no issues. Even subscribed to Netgear Armor for added protection. App was fine. Cannot schedule access limitation times per device and only for entire system so the only way to shut off access per device is by manually going through app. But past few days, app displays “No Device Found”. Reboot doesn’t work. And if you disabled internet access on a device before this new bug appeared, there’s no way to enable it back on the app because again “No Device Found”. Support will tell you to Factory Reset, which is a total hassle not to mention doesn’t work either and not the solution.

title: Problems Logging in After Update
text:
Software and customer support is awful.

The Netgear Orbi app update logged me out and no matter what I do, it will not let me log back in.  I’ve spent frustrating hours trying to fix it & Netgear’s online support is disorganized and ineffective.
The Netgear website give me the WRONG troubleshooting & password recovery info for the model router I have (The Whole Home Mesh WiFi AC3000 / RBK50). The app worked well with the hardware for the first few months, then after a software update the app stopped working.
It seems the only fix is to reset everything to factory settings and set up the network over again from scratch, which is time consuming....Then I guess I’d have to do that again every time Netgear updates it’s app.

So I do not have the benefit of the Netgear App, which helps to maintain and police the network. The mesh network provides better coverage around my home and yard than the Xfinity equipment did, but Netgear has a LOT of work to do to make its website accurate and for the app to work as advertised with the hardware.

The hardware is great; the software and support website need a lot of improvement.

title: WOW!!! Amazing mesh WiFi6 System
text: For a brand new WOW!! WiFi. Numerous options to set up and fine tune the system. Especially like the guest access and extreme while home coverage. Expensive, but for a non IT support person, it is worth every $ to cover my rather large home. Great work NetGear! umerous options to set up and fine tune the system. Especially like the guest access and extreme while home coverage. Expensive, but for a non IT support person, it is worth every $ to cover my rather large home. Great work NetGear!

title: Works great except….
text:
1.  It would be nice to provide a sort function when looking at connections on individual router or satellites like there is on the Device Management screen.
2.  Provide screen rotation to view the app in both landscape and portrait modes for iPads.
3.  This is the MOST important one of all.  Bring back the setting to Disable/Enable SSID Broadcasting and put it in the app itself if possible.  I don’t want to broadcast my network’s SSID name to nosey neighbors or kids passing by.  Now that I have excellent signal strength and range with my Orbi RBK850  EVERYBODY see’s my network name.

title: Best app to check out your WiFi
text: Netgear has always had great products but this one with the use of the app is outstanding. I’m not a computer guru, know enough to get myself into trouble occasionally but living at the Great Smoky Mountains choices for Internet are slim, so you go with fast speed provider and incredible.  Having 7 people using various devices WiFi speed was critical. Having the use of the app is I can make sure that all the satellites are working at peak.

title: Device and app don’t work as expected
text: I purchased the RBR50 router with satellite this week and the device consistently loses connection from the modem. Traffic manager worked correctly for the first day but is now stuck showing no data usage at all. No amount of refreshing will update the statistics. I’ve had to reboot the router 3/4 days I’ve owned the device. There is no indication the WiFi isn’t working until you try to use it. Connection to the router is fine but the router struggles to maintain internet connection, even though it is plugged in via Ethernet to the modem. It doesn’t automatically try to resolve the issue, you have to find out your device isn’t actually connected and manually reboot the device.

title: I get warnings but I can’t tell anything after that.
text: I get warnings of a blocked dangerous URL, but then it’s difficult to impossible to tell what got blocked. You tap on the blocked URL then it tells you that you need to open something else to find out more. Well, duh!  I tapped to find out details so why not open whatever needs to be opened to find out more. But wait, there’s more. When you do open the new app, it drops you at a screen where you get to guess what’s next. If you do guess correctly, you still get bupkis; it just tells you that something was blocked. You don’t need to know; you’re too stupid to understand, so they’ll handle it.

title: The app is fine, the customer service unacceptable
text: I want to love my Orbi and Orbi app, but I probably won’t ever buy Netgear again, since there is no free customer service (not even email or text) after 90 days, even though the device is still under warranty.  The paid customer service available is $50 for one event, or $90 for a six month period.  So I’m stuck doing customer service by google-searching forums.  After about four hours of pain I got my WFH family back online after a problem with a firmware upgrade, but the next time I can’t do it myself, I’ll buy from a competitor...

title: App no longer working
text: For the last several weeks this app has been terrible. Failing to open connected devices tab (CDIL-API-FAIL), not showing the right number of connected devices when it actually works, shows no devices when I look under the satellites, very slow to load whatever does work, basically useless. It would also be nice to be able to modify the DHCP Server Starting IP address because when we have the slightest power blip the Orbi refuses to link back to the other Orbi satellites and smart devices so I have to manually go in and change the starting IP address… talk about inconvenient when you’re out of town and you lose the ability to see your smart devices at home.

title: Opaque Behavior
text: The app does not provide information about why I should wait a whole minutes to connect to my network when it has already connected.   The setup fails to connect to my network, and the prompts did not suggest that I might make it connect by going to “settings” to file a page under the network login to complete setup through a web page having nothing to do with the Orbi app.  Then the app made me go through those same setup steps.  It seems to be working now, but I do not like the cavalier attitude of the app team that I wouldn’t be able to help them get things working with more info about what’s going on.

title: Took me close to (2) hours, very frustrating
text: The setup of my Orbi RBR753 mesh network did not go really well.  The app wasn’t connecting to the mesh network and then it could not find the router and satellites.  Then I needed to rename the mesh network to match my current router and then the orbi couldn’t find or recognize the network after I renamed it.   I had to keep quitting the app, unplugging the router and starting over several times.  Finally the app started moving along and then it came to the firmware update which crashed the app and then I had to restart the entire process again.  I hope this isn’t an indication of my future with this product.  I have really high hopes for this product.  So far I’m regretful.

title: Misleading Speedtest & Confusing Setup
text:
Hint to users during setup, the default admin password is “password” and not the custom SSID password that comes attached to the router. 

The speed test in the Orbi app is nice until you recognize that it is only a test of the modem and router and doesn’t give you the speed delivered to your device over WiFi.   What bandwidth my device actually has is what matters the most to me.  

Since my new mesh network is not delivering consistent bandwidth, so diagnostics would be helpful.

Example:  Google won’t reliably load in Chrome on my trusted Mac, but the Orbi app says I have 70mds of download and >10mb of upload speed. 

The app and the device instruction do not included provisions for custom setups like static IP addresses and security types. 

 Orbi requires a Netgear account be setup before the app works.  I don’t see the value in this but I do see potential security vulnerabilities when I expose potential access control of my router to Netgear (or any outside party).  

Good chance this who Orbi mesh system will be returned.

title: Netgear
text:
So far, so good. It has a fewer newer features, kinda of neat. I’ve used Netgear products in the past, nothing really stands out as problematic. 

I like the app loaded from the Apple store. Simple and provides notifications. That’s also neat.

It’s simplicity for installation was overwhelming easy. I’ve been performing all the tech related crap for years. My wife is very smart but I maintained networking for the home. This was literally plug and play. Seriously.

Adding the satellite was a nice addition. Even better, it’s a 4 port switch. This would helped when I installed a mocha device, internet over coax. It would have been an easier install. Also would have saved a few bucks.

For the average Joe or Joan that has alway depended on your neighbor, kids, friends, geek squad, no more. Plug in base station near cable modem, add 1 or 2 satellites around your house. Configuration is a
snap. Choose you network name (SSID)... add a password, and you up and going.

Good product.  👍👍👍👍

title: Keep going offline
text: I bought the router with 2 satellites and unfortunately, it keeps dropping the internet. When I called support, I spoke with some foreigner who barely spoke English and he said I needed a software update (which I had recently done). When he went into the system he couldn’t find the update and then proceeded to download a previous version and said that will fix your problem and if you don’t contact us within 2 days I will close the ticket. He also blamed me for buying too many satellites for my home and said that was part of the problem. It is still dropping the internet but I can’t afford to spend 2 hours on the phone with someone who I can’t understand and blames me for their $&##% product. But a different WiFi system!

title: Forces registration
text:
The orbi app used to be able to used locally without giving any personal info to netgear. This version of the app forces you to sign up with a netgear account in order to use it at all. Regardless of whether you want or need remote management.

Another issue (but more understandable) is that the app refuses to connect if you’re not on wifi. I use a VPN and should be able to “vpn in” and manage the orbi wifi. This isn’t possible in the app (but is via web—because web doesn’t force a “on wifi” check). What it should do is attempt to connect and only if it can’t, give you info that you’re not connected to wifi.

title: Fast but Troubled
text: Fast as all hell when it works, but the frequent disconnections and un-syncing from the satellites make those gains negligible.  Feature control through the Apps is weak for the price and even the parental controls are third party using Disney Circle, which charges for advanced capabilities standard on systems like Google WiFi.  Last and very important, the router blocks my Synology NAS from external connections, a feature that worked fine with the lower strength cable WiFi router and later with a Google OnHub attached.  Good thing I bought it at Costco.....I’m taking it back for 4-pick Google WiFi system.  Willing to trade slower overall internal WiFi for consistent connectivity and better feature set.

title: Practical,Intuitive and Stylish
text: Only had the product for 24 hours and am completely satisfied with the performance through out my 2000 square foot home. The spouse hates my computer and network devices (the old Asus Roiter "Mothership" and everything else that blinks. This small decorative router sits behind a few picture frames and easily performs as good as the Asus AC3100. The added satelite eliminated our need for a powerline module in the home and has the same impact with the lessened footprint in the office, where we eliminated the network switch and the powerlone module.

title: Broken in iOS 14
text:
Does not have a way to grant access to Local Network. Broken in iOS 14.

Uninstalled then reinstalled and can no longer successfully login. It gives an error about a push notification not being received.

Contacted support. They didn’t try to find the root cause - just recommended to uninstall and reinstall. It worked that time. Now it doesn’t work at all. The Local Network access shows up and is enabled and the phone is connected to the right WiFi network but the Orbi app cannot find it. I offered to help Netgear support understand this failure to fix the root cause but they were not interested. The app is part of your product and you don’t appear to be supporting it.

title: Do Not set up using the App
text:
I am now waiting on my third router. Each time I set up the router using the app everything went well until the firmware update. Once the firmware update completed the SSID was no longer available. Tech Support has tried to be helpful, but they have no clue why this has occurred. They insist that my two experiences are the first evidence they have had that it is related to the app (I doubt that) but next time I will try the manual install.

5+ hours on the phone with tech support (which is not part of Netgear) and with the Netgear store. It has been a very frustrating process, but I hope the third time is the charm. I hope the next one works as expected and it worth the time and effort

title: The App is Worthless and Unusable
text: At first I thought that the Orbi devices and the App were great, they worked well and gave me great WiFi. Then Netgear changed the App, they required me to create an account just to access my network, even when I was already on my network. Now the app is requiring me to provide my GPS location just to run the App. I’m sorry, but I do NOT want to give Netgear my location just to be able to manage my network from the App, this to me is a privacy issue. There is NO reason I should have to provide this information just to use the App. I am getting rid of my Orbi system and moving to a different manufacturer that does not invade my privacy by requiring me to give over too much information, Cisco is at the top of my list.

title: Good device
text: We’ve been using the Netgear Orbi for about a year with no major issues. I have a workshop that is about 80 feet from the main house and need access to the network. I also require access from an RV located about 150 feet from the main house. Since installing the Orbi in the house with one satellite Orbi in my shop, I am able to access the Internet from both the shop and the RV, although the distance to the RV does cause some drop off issues, for the most part it works well. All in all, the Orbi works well.

title: Excellent so far
text: I’ve only had the Orbi for three days but I’m happy. Took a couple of hours of installation but I blame that primarily on a dearth of instructions. I am blown away with the speed. The Orbi 3-pc system is replacing a Wi-Fi system consisting of three Apple AirPort Extreme base stations connected by Ethernet cable. Even though my ISP was telling me I was getting at least 200 mbps download, the previous Wi-Fi setup was only providing 95 mbps unless you were sitting directly in front of the router.  The Orbi system is delivering 255 mbps download throughout the house! Yes I’m happy!!

title: SUPER BUGGY APP!!
text:
This app will drive you mad!  I used the device list feature to see all the devices on the network and then I blocked some devices of my sons to prevent access while he is sleeping and NOW THEY DISAPPEARED FROM THE LIST OF DEVICES so can’t get them back online!!! 

This is just the beginning!!! 

They have 2 apps for the device and 1 additional if you use “Circle by Disney” for Parental Control service. 

It took me FOREVER to configure Remote Management because you have to create an account on Netgears website and IT ALWAYS ERRORS ON SUBMISSION!!!! So it was impossible to create an account.  Somehow it just let me in even though i never actually created my account.  I know right!!?

And in the Genie app if you go to Network Map to see all your devices according to which node they are connected to, Access Control is turned on!!!  I didn’t turn on Access Control. I don’t want MAC Address Access Control turned on. 

...but wait, there’s a lot more problems!!!  

Honestly who QA’ed this app?  I work in QA and this is should never have gone out to the public. 

I am one step away from returning this product back to FRYS!

title: Netgear you are better than this!
text: Netgear you really have to do something about this app. Yes the update it made it a little better but still not what I expect from you guys. I have been your customer for over 10years and You know you are better than this. Please work on a proper app with more features and controls. It's a shame to see other companies with great apps but a mesh system that doesn't even compare to Orbi. I still have Orbi connected as an AP and not using in router mode as functions and parameters need to be improved. You need to figure out device prioritization, parental controls and proper vpn configurations on the router. Hoping you guys come up with a new firmware update and software update soon. I will change my review when I see improvement.

title: Good hardware, OK app
text:
I’ve had my Orbi setup for a few months and the performance has been great! We used to get pretty poor speeds in several parts of the house. Now, it’s blazing fast everywhere.

As for the app, I really liked it at first. It is cool to be able to quickly check my internet speeds, data usage, and connected devices. Now, the super tiny print on the usage chart has pushed it from cool to useless. The speed test is supposed to keep a history so you can see how it performs over time. Today, I find my history completely empty. Oh well. At least the hardware is still good.

title: Don’t update
text: I have been using this system for a year now. Stopped updating app after it started requiring location service be on to access (hate this). System still works but I no longer trust updates not to screw things up. I wait and read reviews before any updates any more to see how things go. Usually update is for something I have no interest in and the company wants me to buy. Too pushy. IfI want a feature I will get it, don’t continuously push it at me.  It’s annoying and reduces my interest in other products each time I have to deal with it.

title: New firmware v 2.5.1.8  won't install
text: I have gone through the new firmware installation process 4 times. Every time it fails. It looks like the router is NOT rebooting after installing the new firmware.   I suspect this is causing the update to fail. So, I did a hard restart of my iPhone hoping that would help. Nope. Instead, it removed the notification on the app's homescreen that a firmware update was available. So I then "checked for firmware updates" in the app. And that resulted in the app reporting that the search for firmware update had failed! What is going on here!! Any suggestions from Netgear here would be appreciated.

title: Awesome signal!
text: I have tried boosters and other devices to improve my signal, as well as updates of cable company equipment. Nothing has worked as well or consistently as Orbi. I have the base at one end of my house where the cable comes into the basement, a satellite in the living room in the center of the house, and a second satellite at the other end of the house in my home office.  We can stream anything I want on multiple devices at the same time anywhere in my house, and nearly anywhere on my property!

title: Ridiculous speeds
text: Ridiculous speeds On the RBK50 and satellite. Maybe overkill for my 2000 square foot home. I get over 500mb downloads speeds from my iPhone over the 5ghz wireless connection.  Me previous wireless router didn’t even come close. The Orbi gives you all of the speeds you pay for from your provider.  The app is cool but not as advance as it’s web interface which allows much more control of the Orbi’s settings.  I’ve used a lot of wireless devices in the past but this one is hands down by far the best I’ve ever experienced.

title: This is be WiFi experience I had been waiting for
text:
First- it is a great looking product as well as the packaging to go with it.

Used it to replace an 4 yr old ASUS router ( RTN65) that was giving me very inconsistent performance and had more than a couple of dead zones around the house.
Setting it up using the App was pretty simple and the interface is much less cluttered than a typical Admin UI for a conventional router.
Now i consistently get upwards of 90/8 up around the house as compared to 30/5 when within 8 ft of the previous router

title: Great App
text: Most companies hastily put together an app to control your WiFi, making it clunky. Sometimes they only let you use a browser. Not with Orbi! It’s so nice to have all of the data at your fingertips, and you can see your usage, shut off the kid’s WiFi, and you can see if the internet is working from there. What’s also amazing is that you can connect via ‘Anywhere Access,’ which is quite handy. Overall great app, no complains so far!

title: Nothing special
text: The app serves its purpose but it is nothing special. I personally prefer to use the web interface in a browser on a network attached computer.  You can perform most tasks using this app once your Orbi is setup. I had a tough time with initial setup using the app. Netgear directs the user to start with the app. Following their direction provided in the box resulted in needing to perform a complete reset of the router. I did figure things out and now it’s all good. App is good to check stats, connected devices, Internet uplink etc.

title: I dread opening this app
text: I need to open this app every few months and before I do... I am filled with dread.  It never cleanly opens.  It almost always fails to recognize me and I either have to log in again, or reset the password, or even go into my browser on my computer and fiddle with it.   Just yesterday I opened the app but it didn’t recognize my password so I had to do a password reset. I selected the same password as I had before, but the app rejected it because it was my old password. What? How can it recognize my old password yet not recognize that same password earlier for log in?  I both dread and loathe this app. Beware.

title: An amazing router
text: I pay for 200Mbps wifi but I was never getting anywhere close to that with the router my internet company provided. Working from home during Covid19 means a ton of zoom calls. My computer kept freezing and I would have to move my laptop near the modem/router to continue my meetings.  Orbi was a game changer for me, super  easy to install and gave me super fast speeds all around my 3500sqft house. This was a great buy and I’m only sorry I didn’t get it faster.

title: Problem solved!!
text:
After struggling months with extenders, running new cable, advanced setup, spending dollars and hours upon hours of effort!  All I can say now is AMAZING! It’s basically PlugNPlay! In just a few minutes after placing the satellite units and and the main unit I was up and running in the entire house with ONE SSID. Strong coverage throughout. My TV, my phone, my desktop, and Alexa all get along great wherever they are placed in the house. Spend the money buy this and your life instantly goes “WiFi” seemless! 
The app is great also! 
Thanks

title: The Orbi software needs more control.
text: We shouldn’t have to either pay Disney extra money each month for what THEY think should be blocked or not. We should have the capability to blacklist or whitelist any and every website PER device on our network, easily and quickly without having a degree in IT and spending hours out of the Orbi software configuring the router directly within the internal router webpages. It should be seamless for us to have this powerful functionality at our fingertips within the software of the most expensive consumer routers on the market.

title: App doesn’t work
text: The latest update showed my satellites were not connected or didn’t show up at all even tho they are working. Speed test doesn’t work and when I try to set an icon for any device it always gets changed back to the wrong icon. I reinstalled the app and Now it keeps asking me to login as admin and I had to reset my password. The next day it’s asking me to login again but it says my password is invalid. I know what it is cause I just changed it. Plus face id was turned on so it shouldn’t ask for it anyway. Disappointed in whoever is running this app because I’ve had this system for a year and nothing with the app has gotten fixed or improved.

title: No VPN or stats by device
text:
The orbi works but falls behind many other similarly priced devices in necessary features. Although users have been asking for it for a while, Netgear has yet to implement VPN at the router level to provide protection for all connected devices.

The other feature missing is any device statistics. You can see your overall data usage, but not WHO is using it.  Which child is using all the data, or has a IOT device been hacked?

Newest security (bitlocker) upgrade trashed a number of IOT devices and had to rebuild them to get the router to connect to them...(cameras, streaming devices, VoIP devices) still no description of how it is protecting those type devices...

title: Finding Devices
text:
I want to put in a layer of protection for my son. I bring up my app and it only shows 14 devices. None of which is any of our families iPad and iPhones. 

I followed the trouble shooting advice, even surfed some non orbi sites via Google. Nothing has worked.

To make it worse, I can get to my admin page and sign in. It simply doesn’t work. This is after following the trouble shooting advice to clear cache, etc. 

For a company that is touts the ability to better secure and protect is not delivering. 

Here’s an idea, make the orbi app, the only thing that seems to be working by the way, be able to troubleshoot and see all the devices using the system. As noted above, the app only shows 14 devices out of at least 25, probably more… They are all working, regardless of not showing up.

title: Decent but clunky product, out-of-date app
text:
Just took a star off of my rating as I had to, yet again, run around to re-sync my satellite with the master unit - manually.  
The app is still not iPad-ready.  I’m just surprised that a product this good has an app this deficient.  

— original review —-

Netgear’s Orbi RBR50 + Satellite work well once set up properly.  I found the initial setup to be clunky with repeated resets and restarts.  My ISP did not set up properly, had to use another router to get the initial DHCP synch with my ISP to work.  Re-syncing the Satellite with the head unit is manual, not automatic, and requires running around the house to reset each unit by hand.  The app is out of date, not iPad-ready (doesn’t rotate, needs to be re-initialized for correct device lists, for example). 

This is an example of a high performance product with poor fit and finish.  I’m not recommending it to non-techies. Yes, it’s fast, but the Orbi RBR50 should be more elegant, should operate more smoothly, should have a good-looking app.

title: Day one 👽👍😉
text: This is my first day with the 4500 sq ft system and I’m amazed, I have been calling the internet company over and over about my speed issues only to realize today it was my router. My speeds have almost tripled, my whole house has service! The app is great and easy to use allowing me parental controls and an on off switch for all devices. The set up took less then 15 minutes, and what I found most impressive is I never even had to get a computer out for setup. So far so good!

title: First Impression
text: I  replaced my old Apple WiFi network with this system. My problem with the Apple was that I wasn’t getting the download speeds that I was paying for, the second and most frustrating problem was that there were areas in the house that I wouldn’t get a strong signal at all (felt like going back to dial up service). Since installing the Orbi (Router + 2 sat) the whole house is blanketed with a strong signal. Definitely I would recommend this system, it is well worth the money.

title: The Orbi system is great the app is mediocre (at best)
text:
I really like the Orbi system and I have no technical issues with it.
However, the app leaves much to be desired. It is mostly useful for monitoring. Yet, for this purpose it relies an my input too often (device names).
My biggest quibble is with the login process, though. Why does the app ask me for a Netgear (or worse Facebook) account to access my Orbi devices when I am on the same, i.e. my, network? I think authenticating against Orbi should be sufficient. After all I can do this from my browser on my computer. (No, I am not interested in remote management from the internet.)

title: Speed up your WIFI
text: I recently purchased the hardware and service for an up and coming Satellite ISP that is much faster than my only other choice of ISPs due to living rural. Although speed tests looked good, my devices were regularly not connected. I added the Orbi system for home WIFI and now I have a very stable, very fast home network. Well worth the $14$149. Connect speeds on my phone and iPad no go as high as 200Mbs, and VPN connection to work is great also.

title: Really, sooo slow, cumbersome
text:
Why do I have to answer to “are you sure?” when I have to go through two screens to turn on my guest network? If I go through the trouble, I obviously want to turn on the guest network that I configured.

Why, oh why, does this $300-plus system lag soooo insufferably just to turn on/off guest-Wi-Fi? 

Why, oh why, does it kick itself off my network and then “can’t join” or “can’t” find every time I switch guest-wi-fi on/off, telling me to go to my iPhone settings to re-join my wi-fi that Orbi just kicked itself off of??!

Why can’t I choose or switch hidden SSID from the App and have to do it after logging into the website?

Why does the Satellite NOT display as connected after opening the App on my phone, until minutes later?

Three Hundred Bucks to take up to five minutes to modify settings, only to be told that the blasted thing fell off your network and can’t rejoin unless you go to iPhone wi-fi settings, WHEN IT JUST WAS ONLINE?

“Run away!”

title: Totally dysfunctional app
text: The app cannot access the Orbi on the local network. Yes, it has been given access permission in Settings. So, who can possibly know what it is doing. Orbi sends notifications saying that it has done something but I cannot find out what that is because the app does not work. I updated the app to no avail. It still cannot connect to its own network. So I cannot administer the system. The help from the app is close to zero: Try Again (same fail), new system setup (already done), Connect via Anywhere Access (takes forever and then says that the device is offline). All this goes nowhere. How does this stuff get out the warehouse door?

title: Still cannot log in without getting a netgear account
text: Each Orbi version update I hope Netgear changes strategy and allows local network management via the iOS app once more. I continue to be disappointed. As an IT professional, I’m telling you the cloud is not your friend! Netgear has had data breaches before, and in general lots and lots of companies have shown themselves unable to guarantee your data safety. It’s impossible. Those of you who want to expose your network to more risk, great! But those of us who want to mitigate that risk will need to continue to use the local web admin unless Netgear decides to start listening to customers and stop dying on their cloud account hill.

title: Switched from Eero to Orbi
text: I recently made the switch from Eero to Orbi, as the thought of increased speeds through whole house due to the dedicated backhaul seemed too good to pass up. First let me say that the Orbi hardware is fantastic. The coverage with just 2 Orbi is on par with the 4 eero that I had. Also, the speeds are as advertised. Really well done. If I was rating the hardware, it's easily a 5. However, the app leaves a little to be desired. In comparison to the Eero app, it feels archaic and doesn't offer the same amount of network customization. While the integrated speed test is nice, I'd like to see something with a little more to offer for advanced users.

title: Horrible log in experience
text: Netgear keeps switching their log in page a few times every few months, every time breaking the iPhone’s ability to either use Face ID or remembered password. This leads to the password being impossible to remember because I’m forced to change it so many times, and I can’t use remembered password or Face ID whenever they decides to refresh their login interface (or whenever iOS updates? I don’t know). On top of all that, they have a super aggressive account locking mechanism after like 3 tries. Once locked, you can’t even switch to one time password. Netgear makes great hardware, but the people responsible for the app should be fired.

title: Excellent all around
text: So I did my reviews and found out that Orbi had the highest rating overall when it came to WiFi extenders. Setup was a breeze though for the tech incline might take a few minutes to get going but you will get going. Now I must add I do not have kids and parental restrictions don’t apply to me but Orbi offers the Circle with Disney app which after going through the app myself if I had kids of my own this would be a great app to utilize when monitoring your kids online.

title: First steps clear, last steps muddy
text: The app worked well at first, but didn’t bring me to a login page. I had to go back to the too brief paper instructions. It took a bit to figure out that in order to log in I had to physically connect to the modem with an Ethernet cable. If this is in the instructions I did not see it. Now we are connected, BUT the speed in the satellite room is about one sixth that in the router room. I expected better given the specs and the dimensional requirements stated in the info at the store and on the outside of the box. If we figure out how to improve upon the speed I’ll provide an update.

title: Functional but no killer features
text: Love the Orbi router system in general. Re: the app, it would be a nice feature to be able to see network traffic at any given time, but in real time, from the app. For example, it would be helpful to open the app, and be able to see what website(s) devices in the house are currently connected to, which devices are currently consuming data, etc. This is geared toward being able to monitor my kids, especially during this school from home period, but would get me in this app much more.

title: Orbi leaves out important Option for Setting Up Network
text:
Orbi By NetGear leaves out the Internet URL Instructions to use when there Orbi App Fails to successfully Set Up your Network, which they know is a common issue.

It also takes them more than an hour to get you Tech Support even when Customer Service sends you directly to a Tech Engineer.

The equipment works very well and FAST!! once you get past the Set Up hassles they could prevent by providing the Internet URL option with the Box Set Up Page.

title: Product is great once install is complete
text: Now that I have successfully installed my NetGear Orbi whole home WIFI It is working great!  It did however take quite a bit of effort and numerous calls into their tech support that is overseas which makes for a difficult time with a language barrier.  They speak English but I could not understand half of what they said.  Sure wish they had some domestic support as the troubleshooting process would have been a half hour instead of four hours.

title: Speed problem solved
text:
Getting adequate internet speeds away from the cable modem router was difficult. Even extenders did not help much and required multiple sign ins depending on where you were located. The Orbi solved the speed issues and the additional information provided by the system was appreciated. While apprehensive about set up because of the need to suspend “bridge mode”, all went smoothly with the ap and instructions.
Would like an article on how to add an additional satellite were the satellite has a different password before I purchase one.

title: Works When Wired to Satellites
text:
My system works well when all units are wired directly to each other. Main Orbi is in living room wired to internet. 1st satellite is 25’ away in utility room at corner of house. It would sync wirelessly, but had occasional connection problems. Wiring it directly to the main Orbi solved this.
2nd satellite is in an outbuilding about 25’ to 30’ from corner of house where 1st satellite is located. 2nd satellite would usually sync wirelessly, but would not stay connected when I tried to use the network. Wiring it directly with underground cable to the 1st satellite solved this. All works great now. But, I expected all units to stay synced wirelessly.

title: Great product.
text: I have a back yard office and was paying for two separate sources of internet. Orbi works for all with 3 pack. It also significantly improved all connections in the house, no more spinning wheel! Single internet source, can easily check speed as well all devices, which I can turn on and off instantly. Great feature, when you need to cut the kids off (temporarily) for excessive use, or quiet time. Highly recommend.

title: Too many bugs
text: I’ve just purchased an Orbi system, and while the system itself is not performing as I had hoped and the setup was too confusing (I’d give it 3 stars and may just return it and try the Eero), the Orbi app is simply not well thought out (not user friendly) and has more bugs than one would expect given the nature and experience of the company behind it (NETGEAR). Example, name one of the units (eg. Livingroom), and when you next come back to it in the app, it has reverted to the original name that Orbi first gave it (eg. Orbi Satellite-2).  Overall, disappointed.

title: Super annoying sales pitch
text:
The app does it’s job to let you see your network, but you’re constantly annoyed by the sales jobs it’s doing to buy it’s parental controls and buy it’s “armor shield”. These two things, that may or may not be useful, should be options to elect to see, but then go away. Instead, they just keep popping up. I don’t have kids at home, and yet I this product keeps reminding me to buy it. And you 

You need this app to setup their router the first time, but after that, I recommend using the web interface.

title: Solid signal throughout house & yard
text: After spotty service from a Nighhawk router, I was hesitant about buying another Netgear product. However, after reading several positive reviews of the Orbi mesh system, I took the plunge. The good reviews are justified. I have a ~4000 sq ft house and I get a solid signal throughout and all over the yard. The Orbi app provides many management tools and an accurate speed test. I’ve recommended the Orbi system to friends who are unhappy with the modem/router provided by our local cable system.

title: Good but still missing something
Wifi everywhere 4real
text: Had a crappy eero system that didn’t cut it. Got this Orbi system and now I have 0 issues.   Love how easy it was to set up in under 5 minutes.  The app is great and easy to use.   What I liked most was the option to plug into the satellite orbi with an Ethernet cable from the Nadia shield pro I’m using which gave it the best performance possible! Even when gaming I have zero loss or pausing like I did with the eero system.  Plus I got this system for less than the eero which was ok with me

title: Die Hard Apple Fan
text: Stuck with my Apple Time Capsule router/Wi-Fi, and AirPort Extreme extenders until I could no longer put up with the poor performance. I did a ton of research over 3 months and decided on Orbi’s RBK50 for our 2 story, 3,000 sqft home. Set up was Apple-like, plug and play. After only a few weeks, I’m very happy with performance and much, much better range. So far, no drop outs that others have reported. I should have purchased Orbi months ago. I will report back after a few months.

title: Looks good but app unreliable
text: Several elements of the app (or router, I don’t really care which) don’t work. After completing the initial router setup through the app and receiving confirmation of this from the app, I exited the app. Next time I entered it insisted the router had never been set up. When trying to run an internet speed test through the app it insisted there was no internet connection, even though I was able to get full internet access through a web browser using WiFi and no cellular data. When trying to activate features such as remote controls through the app, the app told me the request had timed out after a mere 2 seconds of attempting this. So far I am extremely unimpressed with the orbi experience.

title: Excellent performance and easy to set up
text: Orbi and app work great together. System is easy to set up. The mesh system is much better than the single system we had before. We live in a 2 story townhouse shaped like an L downstairs. Had an Apple AirPort Extreme that worked great for many years. Recently some devices started to slowdown. Count of devices grew into the 20s recently so not sure it that contributed. App helps me name and track each device. Absolutely worth it.

title: Netgear account required
text:
Setup on my laptop went smoothly, but the mobile web interface is crippled with no configurability. I don’t have my laptop with me right now, so I download the app. Lo and behold it requires a Netgear account. Garbage tactic to get people to create accounts and share sensitive information. I don’t want my router sending my network stats/settings/info to Netgear, Disney, or anyone else. Security? Bloody ridiculous.

Update: Upon relaunching the app, I was allowed to log in locally. It’s still absurd that it initially tries to trick admins. The app itself doesn’t seem to include any of the advanced settings, either. Access control is either hidden away somewhere or excluded. SMH.

title: Great, when it works
text: Bought the Orbi meshed wifi to replace an old Apple WiFi system that eventually became obsolete. I have four units and when it works it is great but too often it simply doesn’t work. The app does not provide any help trying to search for faults or turning features on and off. In most cases the web version is the only way to connect to the system and provides much better control, but it is not user friendly though. It is possible to force a reboot from the app but in most cases the app won’t even connect as it requires the wifi system to work perfectly.

title: Worked flawlessly on my iPad but failed on iPhone
text:
Was unable to get passed the satellite portion of the set up with the error can’t connect to the router. Downloaded the setup app to my iPad and was able to complete the setup. It would be nice as well if the setup was more global.

The app if used on different hardware seems to need to go through the setup options before you can change any settings. Maybe I just missed something but it should be a bit more seamless if I didn’t.

title: Two or Three piece orbi router
text: I’ve been using my orbi mesh for about two weeks now. So far it has lived up to expectations by providing excellent coverage for my home network that is close to 3000 square feet. I bought the Rbr20, which has the main router and 2 additional units. As it turns out, the main router with one additional piece would have been more than enough to do the job. I hope this helps someone who is trying to decide on buying the two piece or the three piece router.

title: Shove it
text: The absolute worst system for WiFi. I hate everything about the program and the fact I have to download an app make an account just to set up a WiFi where I’ll hopefully never have to see the app again is just stupid. Can’t we just go back to a time when things were simple and companies weren’t shoving their crap down our throats just so they can sell our information to other companies. If a product is good then you shouldn’t have to market the upgrade it should be something useful that people want to buy but instead you force us to give you all of our information so you can contact us every time there is a little new thing you want to sell.

title: Routers are good, app is hot garbage
text:
The Orbi router & satellite I purchased mostly work well, but the iOS app is hot garbage.  Half the time it can’t find the routers on the network (the same network the iOS device is connected to), and the other half of the time the app gets stuck in a login screen that doesn’t work (my credentials aren’t accepted - perhaps due to a plus sign ‘+’ in my email address?).  And yes, those same credentials work just fine in a browser on the same iOS device.

Netgear - please allow the user to skip the login and perform router administration on the local network *without* having to log in to the netgear online service.  Please also fix device discovery - it is not even remotely reliable enough.

title: Big Improvement
text: The new app is a big improvement over previous versions. I really like the Speedtest option from the router. This is great since it removes device speed from the equation and the router itself is running a Speedtest. I think this is one of the only a few routers I have seen with this feature. Great update over the previous app which was very limited. I would still love to see more of the router settings controllable in the app since all you can really do is change the WiFi password in the app and run a Speedtest.

title: Subscription service bags are lame
text:
I bought the router and satellite for the hardware capability/coverage. That part works great. 

The subscription service for features is not so great. I understand the business model, but security and parental controls seem like pretty core functionality to me. 

Even worse, I can’t seem to find a way to get the app to stop spamming me with notifications about these paid services after exploring the features. Once or twice would be understandable, but I’m hitting serious notification fatigue with these reminders.

title: So-so app.  Rampant data collection with no opt-out if you use it
text:
The app it self...it’ ok. It has some neat info displays but doesn’t have the same level of functionality as the web GUI. 

…but here’s the big problem: you must create a Netgear login to use it and IT CONSTANTLY COLLECTS DATA AND ASSOCIATES IT WITH YOUR LOGIN if you do. While other Netgear product lines allow you to opt out of data mining and creating a Netgear account the Orbi product line HAS NO OPT OUT! It says so right on their support site. 

To use this product without Netgear spying on you skip this app. Just use the web GUI to manage your network and do not create a Netgear login or associate your Orbi device with it. If you want to go the extra step put the ip addresses Netgear uses for data collection into your firewall and redirect them to localhost.

For a company whose business is networking and security, having an app that demands you create an online account is unacceptable.  Use the local web interface which is better anyway but demand better from app makers!

title: Not working properly with iOS 14
text:
When installing the app and attempting to set up my Orbi, the app prompted me that I would need to allow “local network access”. I selected the button to continue and it said I would get a prompt to allow this. No prompt appeared. The app is failing to detect my Orbi and says to check the Orbi app settings to enable “local network access”. Unfortunately, there is no option in the settings app under the Orbi app to enable “local network access” and under Settings -> Privacy -> Local Network Access, the Orbi app is nowhere to be found on the list of apps.

I can’t even set up my product because of this. Hope this will be fixed ASAP!!

title: No more device manager filtering in the latest version???
text: I updated to the latest version of the Orbi app. on my IPhone and now I can no longer filter the devices in my network device list by IP address, device name, 2.4 Ghz vs. 5 GHz , etc.  What happened to it?  Also we can’t choose which satellite (or the the router) that our devices commect to on our network, nor can we choose if a device gets put onto the 2.4 GHz network or the 5.0 GHz network. We should have more control of the hardware using the Orbi app. Otherwise it’s a decent app.

title: Great Product
text: I’ve had an Orbi for almost three years. It is the one of the best purchases I’ve ever made. My family has amazing WiFi on our whole property!  That’s right, it’s not just fantastic WiFi everywhere in my house, we get WiFi on our whole property which is almost an acre.  I have four children that all use devices. Everything works!  I’ve recommended Orbi to numerous friends and family. It gets the job done.

title: Excellent!
text: The Orbi app is great at allowing you to set up and manage your WiFi network. It might not allow you to tweak and manage some of the more in depth technical parameters, but that’s not what this product is designed to do. Orbi is designed to provide a fast and reliable WiFi network with quick and easy set up and it excels at both. Being able to check on the status of the network when not at home is a very handy feature. Great app!

title: Stop Gathering All My Information
text:
App works great if you want to to be forced to login to netgear (not required for App to work ) or forced to share your location. (not. required for app to work ).  

I’m sick of companies harvesting my data for no benefit to me. Especially when I actually pay for your product.  Sorry netgear! I may have sucked it up and used the  “orbilogin” website.  But you’ve taken this whole data gathering thing too far. 

Im going mange the router with the web interface.  Who knows how much of my personal info your router is sending you about me.  Probably quite a bit given the state of this app.  Should probably buy an enterprise class wifi system from another vendor

title: Good app replacement for Apple airport app
text: Finally had to purchase a new Wireless router knowing that airport extremes aren't being updated any more. Went with the Netgear orbi system and have been satisfied so far (2 years). I was worried about crappy software to manage the router. The Netgear desktop site is the same cumbersome stuff as it was fifteen years ago, bit at least looks nicer than it did in the past. But this software app is pretty nice and full featured, and is a solid equivalent to Apple's Airport Utility app.

title: Finally good internet!
text: The Orbi Mesh Wi-Fi6 with 2 satellites  has solved the wireless issues we’ve been having for so long! I have an old house with plaster and wire walls and had issue every day, all day! But now I don’t even have to think about whether the internet is working, it just does. And it works throughout the entire house. The Wi-Fi even reaches to the back fence in my yard. The only thing I’m not happy about is that I didn’t get this sooner!

title: Great hardware, terrible app
text: The hardware works just like one would expect. It’s great - certainly issues than previously. But the app is terrible. Not all settings for the router can actually be controlled, so one has to go back to the typical local website. I recently checked and months of firmware updates were not done with no notice of any error from the app. Had to be done in the website. On top of that the app is continuously trying to sell me stuff. I even get notifications trying to push stuff. Inappropriate

title: Easy Peazy!
text:
Bought my Orbi with a satellite and setup was easy and the results are fantastic. 

My old router could handle the increased speeds provided by Spectrum and was terribly unreliable; constant service interruptions requiring restarts and not a strong signal throughout the house. (I have aRanch style home with about 1,550 sq ft on each level)

I just placed the base closer to the north side of the house and the satellite on the same level closer to the south side (about 30 ft apart). The result is I have blanket coverage upstairs and down including garage, deck and entire yard. Our basement walls are made of solid concrete with thick plaster walls upstairs. Orbi gives a strong signal everywhere in the house with only minimal signal fall off in the farthest corners of the basement. 

Definitely Recommend Orbi if you’re looking at a mesh system.

title: Horrible Mobile application and the most worst customer service
text:
Here are the laundry list of issues with the app and followed by the cutomer service.
please use your hard earned money for a better product

1. most of the time login does not work
