title: Not working need firmware update
text:
Upgrade to RBK53S, still having problem with app. Trying to figure out 7 of 7 days finally called for tech assist. They say its the app. I have been rebooting system(lots), resetting attach equipments, reset to factory once, synchronize etc. it work after resetting and reboots sometimes then below problem comes. 
Problem: 
1. On device manager, after updating all 24 icons and descriptions all updates goes away. It goes back where you started from. 
2 on Network map, the router plus 2 satellites it says “NO CONNECTED DEVICE FOUND”. Its blank. 
When its working (3 times is 7 days) some of attach equipments has good strength of signal. 

When its not working thru checking equipment app., signal strength go low (about 30-40% lost signal strenght). Im using iphone 11 max, iphone 10xs max. Please update app.

title: Easy Set Up. Excellent coverage and speed!
text: Replaced a 10 year old wireless system from another manufacturer. Was concerned about spending this much. Did my research. Made the jump. Profoundly easy to set up. Was up and running in 10 minutes. Two floor 2700 square foot home. Lots of devices. Great coverage. Quadrupled my connection speed over wireless and five times or more at the Mac connected directly to the system hub. Very happy with my decision! Simple and elegant design of the app also.

title: Power to control your network
text: Network setup was not without hiccups as with any app based setup. Had to reboot a couple times, rescan QR codes to join network again, etc. but did it without assistance. Once you are set up, it gives you incredible control over your network. From seeing who is on network to controlling their access, download speeds with history, parental controls, and updates over the air. Just got started but I’m impressed.

title: This was a nice app to manage my ORBI setup but no longer
text:
This used to work great in my home network but now it claims I need a Netgear account.  Why?  I am within my network, in my home, with credentials to access the ORBI devices without internet connection (which sometimes happens and I need to check the ORBI...)

This is unacceptable.  The router should always be administrable even with zero internet connectivity.  This login requirement is completely inexcusable.

I wish I could get my $1,000+ of investment into ORBI equipment back as this is completely unacceptable.  (It was bad enough that it kept asking for location data, another thing completely unneeded)

title: Great System. App needs some attention.
text: I love the mesh system, but I do have some issues with the app. It can take some time to load. There have been a few issues where I entered the names of my connected products and they would revert back. It could use an overhaul. It’s not bad by far, but when I pay for top of the line, I expect the app to be on point. I would hope to see a lot more attention to it in the future. Great products all in all though.

title: Orbi Review
text: The setup was easy and quick, but there was an issue shortly after we started connecting all our devices. The WiFi would keep dropping and getting picked up again, over and over. I restarted both the router and satellite receiver and that issue was resolved. Other than that, it has worked flawlessly and the remote management app looks good and works well. The devices look cool and classy so it should fit in just about anywhere.

title: A app with reasonably executed features
text:
It is simple to use. But wish that the history of the speed test would be visible longer. And keep an history of all the tests.

The text of the data usage for the month is very small. And wish it would give you options to show even multiple year if you wanted (export option as a CSV). And the ability to show usage as GB and TB. 

Other then that it’s fine. But think that a lot more could be done. Especially since the equipment is so expensive!

title: Orbi and Netgear
text: Orbi is a good Wi-Fi system which is hampered by the worst IT support.  IT support is provided off shore and probably on farms. There was a rooster crowing in the background. They have no access to higher level support so your at the whim of whoever answers the call which has wait times approaching 30 minutes. Depending again on whom you get the accent can be heavy. This is penny wise and pound foolish. Selling a Wi-Fi system at the high price but providing low end support makes me feel value is poorer. Spend less money on marketing and packaging and more on IT support.

title: Great Device
text: I was having speed/signal issues on second and third floor of my home.  We stream a lot and have multiple gaming systems going at one time, prior to Orbi, my speed and signal was horrible in parts of my house. Now, my speeds and signal are amazing, so much so, I may be able to drop my speed!!  More money savings back in my pocket.  Initial upfront coat but no more 250 a month cable and internet bill.  Great device, hope it continues, only time will tell.

title: Update Giving download Speed Issues
text: Ever since the new firmware for the Netgear Orbi, all my connected devices are throttled to a 12-18 mbps download speed with no fix whatsoever in the Netgear community forum. If I cable my computer to the router, then it will hit 600+ mbps but on WiFi, nothing comes close to it. The updates with the Orbi app with parental controls needs to be nerfed. So many pop-ups when I was trying to resolve my Orbi issue. Unlock premium, unlock premium, it gets annoying. If this persists till next week, I might as well return the Orbi and pick up an Asus router that has QoS control. I hope Netgear fixes this bandwidth issue sooner than later.

title: Out with the old and in with Orbi
text: I own an internet company and despite having high speed the old router was just too old and the connection would go down a few times a day. Everything would have to be reset. Not anymore!!! I have not lost a connection in two week and using my iPhone in the house, anywhere in the house is no problem. Great work! Love the Orbi !!!it's the best !!!

title: Great once we figured out
text:
Great once we figured it out and registered a bunch of logins. 
Things to be ware of that is not easily found. Don’t toss the clear covers with the router model and serial as u will need it. Start with the phone app only!

Do not connect the internet router Ethernet to your satellite units unless your not connected to the yellow “internet” wan port on the orbi router. Write down your multiple logins. 
Once your done, you will find that it is a robust mesh system and I am impressed. You can monitor it remotely also. One person on the router at a time. E

title: Lack of functionality and low performance
text:
Ready and easy to setup mesh home system but very inconsistent when it comes to connectivity and performance.
Connection keeps dropping from the satellite although positioned right. More than 50% of the times it works well but then  suddenly, and for no particular reason it drops internet speed. On the main router is very consistent and on the upper side of performance but the challenge is with the satellite 
The app itself has limited functionality but caters for almost all user needs. It lacks majorly on satellite management and administration which I believe the main problems occur

title: Probably the worst router ever
text:
As I’m sure most have suggested the router was great for about a few weeks, then maybe it was an update maybe it was just the hardware, but constant problems with connecting remaining connected dropping internet but maintaining WiFi. Some days I get better speeds on lte with one bar then I do with WiFi with a static business ip with dedicated 100 down 30 up.

Sad that I removed an AirPort Extreme and several airport expresses from my network and replaced them with this garbage. It’s bad when almost everyday I deal with this for the price of the system.
The app is useless and provides no real interface with the router.

Compare that too the aged airport app and it’s sad. I should at the minimum be able to perform the same functions I did within the airport app. And not have to get on a computer to truly configure my router.
Nuff said. I’m stuck with this garbage.
Don’t buy.

It’s not a mesh network. But it also can’t compete with a simple AirPort Extreme/ airport express non mesh network which is frustrating in itself.

title: The worst experience
text: I have a brand new Orbi system and this app made setup a nightmare. I almost returned the devices just because setup had to be completed with this app. It’s buggy and interfaces poorly with the devices so I had to factory reset them multiple times because if you change the network name at the customization step then when the app inevitably fails or reloads itself it no longer locates the device because it searches for the old name. Even better when you finally do get it set up the app immediately hits you with ads to buy a useless paid service to “secure” your network. Absolute garbage.

title: Disappointed with Orbi
text: I was hoping Orbi would be a good purchase, and I must say that - when it works - the WiFi performance is pretty good. However, I have found that Netgear’s software and firmware quality is consistently substandard. It seems that every update introduces new problems. The latest bug with the iOS app is that it does not report connection speeds on my satellite unit. And I should also mention that the app is verrrry slow. The Orbi firmware releases are also suspect. I have had to downgrade to get my system functioning properly again after an “upgrade.” It seems to me that Netgear has a flawed software quality assurance program.

title: Good so far!
text:
Still first day using it. Good so far!

New users should be patient, each step of setup has a built-in 2 minute wait. Glad to have a reliable process, and to know about how long each step might take. But be warned first setup can take 20 min.

When setting up 2-factor authentication (SMS) it took a couple hours, with no way to cancel nor navigate out once started. The lack of cancel out of this setup step is why 4 star, not 5. I had to force-quit. It picked up the Orbi setup fine after force-quit.

title: User Interface Not As Advertised
text: I love this router but the app is buggy.  When looking at the previews, the interface on my app has a white background when looking at the connected devices and does not separate them by bands.  I have the bands combined but it should still tell me which ones are connected to which bands.  You can do it now by selecting the device but the screen shots in the App Store shows it all on one screen with a blue background but my app has a white background.  I am on iOS 14.2.  I feel like I am not getting all the features as advertised.

title: Think no further
text: This is one of the best things that could happen to my Internet.  the installation was extremely easy and in less than five minutes I was able to set up the whole router and a couple of satellites. My Internet speed has more than doubled. so without a doubt I would recommend buying this product.  it’s worth investing on this product.

title: Worst update ever
text: This is the worst update ever that you can find on a router.  They added a lot of paid functions and disabled some basic functions that a user used to be able to do.  The device control through browser has been removed and we have to do it through apps.  The new update of the app can’t even recognize the device name.  I now have 6 “apple iphone” and 3 “apple iPad” showing up on my app and I can’t tell the difference.  After I paused one of them I was never able to get it back online again.  This is the worst app.  This is bad till a point that I am looking for a different brand mesh router.

title: Improved WI-FI RELIABILITY
text: I replaced a 6 year old combo router with the ORBI AC2200 mesh network And a Docsis 3.1 WI-FI 6  modem which has significantly improved WI-FI consistency and speed in our condo.  Setup was fairly simple.  It has been running for 4 days increasing internet connection reliability which was much needed with both of us working from home now. Follow the app instructions to the letter.  If you run into problems simply reset the router base and start over.

title: Easy install
text: I read some reviews stating that install was challenging.  I just set mine up and it was a breeze, and this is coming from someone who is “tech challenged”.  The app literally walked me through every step of the process.  It took approx 15-20 min and my entire home (including the garage) is up and running.  My internet speeds have greatly improved as well.  Thanks for the easy and great product Netgear!

title: I like ‘Device Management’
text: This app allows me to see which devices (iphone, printer, desktop, ereader etc) are currently on the Orbi network and I can turn the wifi on / off to individual devices. This allows me to turn off our kids wifi (manually only) to their phones past their bedtime. Nothing fancy but just enough that I don’t need to purchasing a parental control app.

title: U don’t need my location
text:
The app would benefit from usage monitoring capabilities for specific devices. But what really makes no sense is the new update’s requirement that you enable location services even to start the app. That does not make sense for a static home router. Why the change? It makes no sense.
UPDATE:
Got a response from netgear that location services are needed for some services to work, like remote access. Well,  i don’t use remote access, so why can’t you limit location services to the small subset of specific services that it might be relevant to (dubious) and let the app work without them for everything else?  Seriously reconsidering using your products.

title: Great product but a little difficult to set up
text: We have a concrete block home that kills WiFi signal. The Orbi plus 2 satellites has our speed kicking throughout the house - extremely happy! But we did have difficulty setting it up due to incomplete/inadequate instructions and lousy customer service on the live chat. The set up is actually very easy IF ONLY the instructions were clear on how to do it. But finally having a solution that really works was worth the trouble setting it up.

title: Worthless, buggy, lazy app
text:
I’m not normally the type to write app reviews, but felt compelled to in this case to highlight how useless the Orbi app is.

The app refuses to acknowledge the fact that I have a satellite in my setup. The web interface sees it properly, and everything works correctly, so it’s definitely a bug in the app. I have re-run the entire setup from scratch to prove that it wasn’t a fluke.

This app also allows you to configure essentially nothing of any importance. The only thing you can really do is configure security methods / keys for your primary & guest SSIDs, view a device list, update firmware (only as of very recently), and reboot the router. *That’s it*. I end up using the web interface every time I need to view or configure something, since this app does only a tiny fraction of what the system is capable of adjusting.

There’s also no iPad compatible version (it’s portrait only, low res).

I’m very surprised this app is as highly reviewed as it is, to the point that I have a feeling most of these 5-star ratings are shills.

title: Faulty mesh and no useful troubleshooting
text: - No alert if your internet goes down - No alert if a satellite goes offline - No strength of signal status from a satellite so you can figure out where to put it to ensure a stable, high speed connection - No information on competing networks or history of satellite or internet drops - No ability to force a device use the closest satellite - Basically there is nothing you can give to “pro support” to help diagnose your problem So I have fast, stable internet for what is wired, decent wifi for my living room next to the main router, and sucky internet around the flaky satellites…all for $500, thanks Orbi!

title: Simple. Too simple.
text: Very feature restricted. important but simple security and administration functions must be accessed via a web browser, making this app unnecessary for everything except seeing who is connected and seeing if the internet is on, and frankly, who needs to do that? People who are looking for this much simple are probably not going to use the app, those looking for simple admin functions must use the web url to log into the device. It’s a no-mans land of an app, unless it’s purpose is to nag you about software security subscriptions, then it nails it.

title: Needs WORK after update(s)
text:
Really love it when it works but am always nervous when updating the app.  Case in point, the newest update gets stuck on ‘Connecting to Router’  screen and only by deleting & reinstalling the app will it show my usual app screen with connected devices.  Once closed, the app will not work again.  I can still use admin login from a computer to see devices, LAN option, status, etc... but what’s the point of an app if it consistently doesn’t work?

Also, I have same ‘update available’ issue as well, tho only while in the app (before current update).  Web interface shows router and satellite are up to date, but the Orbi app always disagrees.  Please
fix this -  but let’s start with being able to use the app in the first place if possible.

Thanks and overall I love the Orbi app.  Just not today.

title: Pretty grea. Just missing minor things
text:
Overall the orbi app is pretty good. This is one of those moments I'd want to do a half star for 4.5.
There are minor things I'd like to see added, most importantly the ability to do speed tests between the sattelites.
Given that one of my sattelites is wireless I'd like the ability to see what speeds it's able to get from the main router so that I could find an optimal spot in the room.

title: Great Coverage
text: I am very please with my new ORBI system.  WiFi coverage is finally at maximum strength throughout my house.  I also like being able to see all devices on my network and to be able to monitor internet upload and download speeds.  I did have to establish it as a separate IP address from my ATT WiFi IP; but that was fine because that service was not getting the in-house coverage that I wanted.

title: Speed good, many downsides
text:
My speed is great 95 down, 9.4 up.  Good speed throughout my 5000sf home with base and 2 satellites.  But:

I’m having to type on screen as this review does not allow Apple keyboard

Reconnecting printers is a major pain, and some older printers I have been unable to connect over WiFi (Epson Artison 1430)

Does not recognize printers connected with USB and shared, in fact, no means to connect anything to network via USB. 

Security may complicate use:  I’m told I have 156 vulnerabilities, all related to a hard drive connected via Ethernet, mostly duplicates and indicating I need bitdefender, and guided how I may pay for it.

I am unable to open links from trusted emails which I can open with cell data “URL not recognized “ or 404 error. I spent some time with support with only partial resolution. I think this is DSN problem?

In short: good speed, poor support for accessories, no USB support, unexplainable blocks some links.

title: Blazing fast speed
text: We have been paying for 1 GB speeds for quite a while. It wasn’t until we bought the Orbi setup that we are finally getting the speeds we are paying for.  We have a 6,400 square foot home with three levels and we have one Orbi unit on each level and we even get amazing speed in our back Master Bedroom where we used to have WiFi that could barely crawl.

title: Limited Functionality
text: While the application provides the capabilities required to setup the system, it does not help much when it come to debugging issues. It doesn’t even give you a way to select a satellite. It should be easy to give the ability to blink the LED on a device so that you could identify which one you are looking at. It does tells you the connected devices but almost no information about each device. There is no information provided about the channels selected, etc. Adequate for the task, but, not much beyond that.

title: Bought when first released.
text: These are the best web spectrum routers in the market. I cover my entire 2 floor hours and yard with the 3 unit pack I bought 2 years ago and we haven ever had an issue or a problem. The speed with my Verizon Fios 1gb service is insane. We have upwards of 30-40 devices connected through the network including lights and speakers to electronics, phone and laptops and there is never a slow down. Great job Netgear. (I never write reviews and it took 2 years to write this one BUT Neatgear deserves it)

title: Easy but no control
text: We purchased this thinking of the great coverage it is supposed to have. So far, so good. The issue is the misleading advertising. Orbi says family controls are simple.  NOT! You have to have a separate app and account and it has a monthly cost.  It’s a Disney related product so you know there is a cost.  The previous router I had didn’t cover as much area, but had family control included in the software with no additional costs. Anybody living with a teenager knows this is needed.  Because of our home layout we very much enjoy the WiFi coverage, but it is still very disappointing to be misled.

title: Lousy app- Do not purchase Orbi system
text: Notifications are set to receive, but I never get them such as ‘a firmware update is available ‘. Cannot check the signal strength like eero. Nothing for guest network either. Pitiful lack of features. Very disappointing. Cannot contact them via email. They want to charge you for everything. System is plagued with glitches: firmware updating- they tell you to update the satellite FIRST, after you’ve already updated the router FIRST because the instructions don’t tell you that until instruction NUMBER 8!  Buy an EERO, less headaches.

title: So far, it looks great
text: Initially, we had some minor difficulties with the setup process but it took less than 1 hour to have the setup completed.  Once everything was done, we’re getting the results we were expecting.  The spots we were having trouble with the signal are now covered by our WiFi network.  We still need to learn all the benefits of mesh networking but so far we solve our coverage initial problem.

title: Are you Kidding?
text: This latest upgrade for the Orbi system is a joke. Once again after the ”update” the app cannot find the router. All is does is take you to your netgear account and have you try to login. Why is this so broken? Well I can go to any web browser and add the credentials to login. No problem. Try this on this upgraded CR-App and all it displays if ” an error occurred.... Try again”  seriously this is another fine example of pushing a mediocre app. Come on.... For once fix the app!!!

title: Qos
text: This product has been the best product that I have used for internet. I have recently switch to fiber internet 1gb and even before I had done this changed it worked perfectly. But there is one issue that I wish would be fixed and Orbi would be perfect for me. It’s the ability to have qos. Without qos it’s a major deal breaker for me. There is a page but all you get is a speed test. Netgear could you please contact me on this information. This product is truly amazing.

title: Problems after problems!!!
text:
Well at first the unit worked great. But it seams lately all of my devices say they are connected to the ORBI router or Satellite but can’t or are slow using the internet. When I open the app it says it’s online but not connected to the internet. 

I tried to fine a way to update for the firmware for the router but it says it’s up to date and yet also say that my unit is online but not connected to the internet. I couldn’t find a support phone number to help me unless I PAY for a service for a peace of equipment that should be working. All of my other devices I own I can call support free of charge. This is making me want to throw this out the door.

title: Remote management setup just bad
text: Was happy when I heard I could finally manage my system remotely until I tried to sign in. A) I have a Netgear Orbi acct but it wouldn't recognize my password. B) Resetting password from app never produced the email it said I should get. C) Went to website instead via browser and was able to reset password. But wait for it...when I finally signed into the app it said my system was not set up for remote access and I had to be connected to my router to change that. Say what? I want to manage remotely because the system is somewhere else where I am not! This app and system is awful IMO.

title: Horrible app
text:
I purchased a Orbi wi-Fi mesh router and installed this app, with the app you used to be able to change the settings for your Internet speeds that function no longer shows Also it shows my iPhone and MacBook Pro 
As off-line when they are turned on and being used and connected to Wi-Fi I wish I never bought this horrible Wi-Fi mesh system along with this terrible app that no longer functions as it should. After the latest firmware update to the router that’s when all this took place by seen my devices as being off-line. I hope they do another update to resolve this issue!

title: Mostly good
text: I have the router and 3 indoor satellites and 1 outdoor satellite.  I still have trouble with single. Units just drop off the network. They don’t show on the network map, but there is a another link that says show more devices so you can list all the devices. That list will say the unit is online. No real way to tell what it’s not show on the device map and not getting any units connected to it.  Even when you are in direct site of the same room as the satellite. Still needs to be more reliable or give the info of what isn’t working.

title: Great speed and coverage but...
text: I have 2 Orbi RBR20 satellites connected to my RBR50 router and they work great. I can’t complain about my coverage and speed. I would give 5 stars except for 1 thing. When I change some of my device names and icon type they keep reverting back to their default configuration. This is very annoying. I’ve read other owners have the same issue. I hope Orbi will provide a firmware update to address this problem someday!

title: Great App for a great router
text: The app is very thorough giving control over every aspect of the router and satellites. Monitor connected devices, speed and more. Includes parental controls as well. I just want to say hat after using several routers in my home this is the first that truly works as expected. It runs seamlessly in the background with multiple devices from multiple vendors using multiple OS systems. Everything works flawlessly. App and router work as promised.

title: It’s called control
text: You have the power to do anything and everything from your phone. I can see everyone on my network and disconnect them with the touch of a button. I can reset my router from my phone. I can test up and down load speeds when ever from my phone without a third party app it’s absolute control of your net work like it should be !!!

title: Netgear apps are terrible
text:
I have the Orbi system, as well as the Arlo home security system; both are owned by Netgear.  The apps for both of these products let me down time and time again.  I keep getting logged out of the app randomly, the apps can never verify my phone as a trusted device, and to top it off, the apps are slow and lag almost every time I get on them.

Continuous  Poor performance from apps whose hardware cost so much to purchase. If I could do it over again, and wasn’t so invested in the Netgear products, I would go with a different manufacturer all because of the apps these products use.

title: Wish I’d discovered this sooner
text:
My WiFi is faster across all my devices. My signal reaches outside my house to every part of my yard. This is a great product. 

One piece of advice: install and manage your network from the website. It is so much better than using the mobile app initially. Once it’s installed - then the mobile app is great. 

Highly recommend this product!

title: No longer connects to app
text: Ever since updating the firmware on my Orbi router, the app cannot find it. My wife still works great. All my devices still connect to it, but when I open the Orbi app, it says it cannot detect my devices and cannot connect to the network. Even though my phone is currently on the WiFi network for the router. None of the troubleshooting suggestions are helpful since they all give details of how to connect to my network WHICH I AM ALREADY CONNECTED TO. I’d suggesting waiting to update your firmware until it is absolutely necessary next time or you might lose the ability to use the app.

title: Can not get it work
text:
I have spent the last 2 hours trying to set up my Orbi router & satellite. I am able to get as far white light, then I log in to the orbi wifi successfully then trying detect, it gets 1/4 the way then says can not find. I’m still connected via WiFi and my internet works as I do speed tests and all is good. I have xfinity 

I’m really getting frustrated and might just return this product if I can not get to work

title: Fantastic product !!
text:
I purchased Mesh Orbi because I did not get a good WiFi coverage in my house . Since the time Orbi was installed we are able to watch 4K movies while my son is enjoying playing games on line without interruption of slow download speeds . Wifi coverage is fantastic in all rooms specially in the room which is away from the router .
High recommend this product

title: Orbi RBK50
text: Literally took 10 minutes to set up!! We went from an Apple airport router to this one , we never knew how fast our internet was until we hooked up the orbi. I will recommend this to everyone super fast WiFi speed and the range is amazing. I still have excellent WiFi out at 300 feet from our home. Well worth the money. Don’t hesitate just get it you’ll be very happy.

title: Not impressed
text: Orbi is certainly expensive enough that the buyer should expect a smooth install and consistent operation. Since I bought and installed this system in Dec 2020 it has dropped my internet twice and required restarting as well as locked me out of the Circle app that it’s supposed to support. It looks like they dropped Circle and plan to replace it with their own Parent Control app but it’s not available in my (just downloaded) app. So, I have no parental control over my network as of now. I’d seriously consider another product instead of Orbi!

title: Robust, dependable, good
text: I’ve had the Orbi mesh network installed and running for about a month now and have had zero complications … super fast wi-fi on all house levels where I have the main router or satellites. I’ve moved the satellites a time or two and it couldn’t be easier - unplug, move, plug in, done. The app for monitoring/management is robust, clean, intuitive - I’m quite satisfied with it as well.

title: Bad update – do not download!
text:
I’ve been using Orbi for over a year in my large house. Haven’t had any issues, system been working great. After this download, system disconnects 2 to 3 times from the Internet every day. Specifically handheld devices, like iPads and iPhones. Do not download this update! Do not install the firmware that you will be prompted to after this update! Introduced a bug inadvertently. Hopefully they will release another download that solves this problem. I have talked to other orbi users on the message boards and they are experiencing the same problem after doing this download/Firmware update.

Or, please fix this problem! The line thanks, Ira

title: Good Device
text: Makes streaming more comfortable and easy to make a simple network for the home use. The satellites work fine and connections are a breeze. Overall a good device, the security service makes configuration really hard for starters, in my opinion if you have a good security service, you don’t need the Armor suite since it kinda makes the system lag.

title: Well Done
text: Just set up the RBK852 system in less than 10 minutes. Real simple when you follow the instructions. The app is much better than the older Nighthawk and Netgear Genie which were terrible. Getting about 960mb download speed thru the satellite a floor below the router itself. If you are a Xfinity X1 customer you have to enable the bridge to turn their WiFi off from the X1 modem.

title: Basic app
text: The Orbi app is basic and lacks a lot of the functionality that the web interface has. Ideally for example it would be nice to be able to swipe between the different Orbi network devices instead of having to backtrack to see others (between satellites/router). The usage tracking is bare-bones as well. Not everyone is comfortable using the web interface so updating the app is a must. This also affects the type of action that can be taken remotely.

title: Great system - parents control not included in Costco purchase
text:
I’ve had the system for two months, purchased at Costco, and it has worked great providing coverage across 3600 square-ft home.  There are as many as 12-15 devices on it at various times yet it provides al of us fast speeds allowing three people to easily hold seamless zoom call at the same time. 

My biggest complaint is (1) it doesn’t come with parental controls.   You have to subscribe to that separately at about $100/year.   For a relatively high end system that should be included.  Lesser systems often have that.  

Second area is that the support is terrible.  Waiting over 40 min (then hung up).  Tried several times and this seems to be the consistent situation.  

Otherwise, product runs great and covers a large area well.

title: Best Home Use Router
text: As an IT specialist, I have tested and used several different routers over the years. Bar none, Orbi has surpassed my expectations for home use. It’s ability to be scalable, while private robust mesh topology with very little out of the box configuration has proven that the manufacturer did the research to fully capture what its customer needs are, and provide a solid product for a reasonable price.

title: Best $200 investment ✅

title: System is amazing

title: They Charge Extra To Set Schedules On Devices. Enough Said.

title: Problem solved !
text: We have a 4300 square foot home and was having problems making a WiFi connection in parts of the home . title: Orbi app works very well
text: The Orbi app works very well with the Orbi wifi system. It is a nice feature being able to see which devices are connected to the main unit or satellites. title: Does not work with iOS 14
text: Beware! The app won’t function until you allow the app to use your local network but the feature is not available to turn on in the iPhone’s settings. It needs to be fixed, otherwise the app is useless.

title: Lots of Bugs
text: This App appears elegant when you login, but soon you learn of all the bugs. I have an ‘ Armor’ subscription, but it asks me every time I login if I want to start a free trial. The topography is incorrect—all satellites are connected by Ethernet but App says they are wireless. The App feels more like a sales and feedback vehicle rather than a useful, accurate control vehicle. I find myself logging into the web portal when I need to control the network. I really do not like that every Lan reboot requires resetting the VLAN connection, but that’s not an App weakness.

title: 2009 App is Garbage
text: Let me first say that the hardware is outstanding, five stars there. The app, on the other hand, is poorly designed, slow, unintuitive, and lacking features in nearly every area. No reporting, no granularity, no real control. And on top of the pile of garbage, the trash can cherry on top is the fact they will forever solicit their services through  the second tile on their app dashboard. It’s called “Armor.” And it is literally the only thing in the screen with a red status indicator. Give me a break. Please hire real designers and tailor the app for quantifiers and tinkerers.

title: Fast speeds

title: Fast & EASY Setup No Prob,ens Fast Internet Speeds

title: Fatal flaws
text:
The app requires you to log in to your Netgear account before you can do anything with your router or satellites. But I live in a rural area, and my internet connection is unreliable. When trying to diagnose a problem, the app won’t work because I can’t log into to Netgear’s site — even though my iPhone or iPad are connected to the router via WiFi. I want local control and management.

With your new router, you get a free trial of their network security software. But as it gets close to expiring, it starts sending you nagging notifications to buy a subscription, multiple times a day. You can’t just tell it to stop nagging.

Parental controls and monitoring specific devices are hard to use.

Had I realized the app required logging into an account every time, I would have looked for a different product.

title: Doesn’t seem to work well with IOS
